item.title: Navaeh E. Smith
item.description:
Sunrise: September 3, 2003     Sunset: June 23, 2020
Navaeh Emoni Smith, age 16, passed away on June 23rd, 2020 in Colorado Springs, CO. She was born on September 9th, 2003 to Johneshia Smith, Kyonte Lock Sr and Corey Dunlap Sr. in Las Vegas,NV. From the moment Navaeh blessed this earth with her presence would automatically be known and felt. Her beautiful smile and dimples made it nearly impossible to have a bad day around her. Her laughter was one of a kind, contagious, and you could literally hear it from a mile away. Dancing and singing was Navaeh's passion. She would walk around all day, singing her favorite songs and posting Tic Toks while showing off her dance moves. 

Navaeh was recently accepted in the Zeta Archonettes-Zeta Phi Beta Sorority Inc. sisterhood and was really proud of her accomplishments. To say she will be missed is an absolute understatement ! To be absent from the body is to be present with the Lord. Although it is painful to accept, Navaeh's mind is now at peace and she is  now in a better place. One day we will all reach our day of judgement, but today Navaeh would love for you to live, smile breathe, and celebrate life. The goal isn't to live forever; the goal is to create something that will live forever. What Navaeh has created will be everlasting in the hearts and minds of those she touched. She may not physically be with us; however Navaeh's cries have been heard, and her tears were not in vain. The sound of those tears will build upon the legacy that she has created, and the seeds she planted within us all will grow endlessly. We hear you Baby Girl.
]]>

item.title: William L. Ray
item.description:
Sunrise   July 1, 1982                  Sunset   June 11, 2020
William Lemar Ray, also known as Lee and Skii, passed away in Las Vegas, NV on June 11, 2020 Lee was born in riverside, California July 1, 1982 to Bruce Batiste and Valarie Ray Ward. He grew up in a very loving family that expanded from Riverside to Oakland and Las Vegas. He was an exceptional young man and loved being adventurous and playful. At the age of 3 he would run through the Ray family home after a bath with a towel tied around his neck like a cape thinking he was Superman. When he was 12, his curiosity drove him to constantly disassemble and reassemble electronic devices such as radios and appliances to discover how they functioned. After graduating high school, Lee began his journey as an adult weaving his way in the world of work. He dabbled in construction and eventually became an electrician. As he grew older, he continued to care for his family, always the friendly Superman in the room. He enjoyed music, fashion, dancing, and telling elaborate stories with his 'DeeBo' sarcasm and a devious smirk on his face. He was blessed by God to be a father figure to his first niece Nile and eventually welcomed 3 children, Omari, Jaylah and William Jr.
As he grew older and larger, his size led him to take up Ninjutsu where he learned discipline and agility. He mastered this skill so well that he was invited to a Ninjutsu tournament where he met Steven Segal. Lee loved his little brother Derrick. He always protected him and made sure he knew he was the boss. He also spent many hours with his cousins as he treated them like brothers teaching them how to be tough and walk like a ninja. He loved the fiercest pit bull and the gentlest cat. He was able to train them with q snap of his finger or with his famous finger point. The gym was his second home. Many photos of him reveal his six pack under tight T-shirts. He loved to lift weights. It gave him peace and serenity and motivated others to work out and strong.
Lee enjoyed and loved being with friends and family, especially his children. His love for all children in his life is evident in the outpouring of well wishes and tributes as they shared memories of him coming around; he was their Superman who came to play. Lee lived his last days saying goodbye to those he loved in his own way; very loving and unselfishly thinking of his mother, his children and his siblings He leaves for us to cherish, his essence, so powerful it surrounds us like the sky.
]]>

item.title: Dorian Jarmond Benjamin
item.description:
Sunrise  January 27, 1974           Sunset  June 21, 2020
Dorian Jarmond Benjamin was born on January 27, 1974, in Los Angeles, CA to Clara Anita Wilson and Jerry Payne Benjamin.

Dorian resided in Las Vegas,NV where he attended school in Reno, Nevada in their Job Corps Program and later graduated from Sunset Adult High School. Dorian moved to Hawaii fro 5 years where he worked as a cook. He later returned to Las Vegas and started a career as a Kitchen Worker for local restaurants.

Dorian was united in marriage to Naomi Latrece Benjamin from April 10, 1994 to June 24, 2004. To this union two sons were born Dorian Benjamin Jr. and Deshawn Benjamin. Thereafter he met Alisa Nicole Croston. They soon had a daughter Angela Croston and he built a special relationship with his Stepdaughter, Markita Croston.

Dorian enjoyed watching Football especially watching his favorite team the Raiders play. He also enjoyed listening to music. In particular 2 Pac. Dorian touched the hearts of everyone he came in contact with. His smile and laughter would light up any room he would enter. His presence and voice will be forever heard/felt in our minds and hearts for forever.

On Sunday, June 21, 2020 (Father's Day) the Lord said "well done my good and faithful servant" and he dispatched an angel to give Dorian his ticket to Heaven.  
]]>

item.title: Dean F. Anderson
item.description:
Sunrise April 8, 1955  ~  Sunset June 27, 2020
Dean Fernell Anderson was born on April 8, 1955, in Flint, Mi to the proud parents Clarence "CB" Anderson and Mamie E. Moore (Hall) and is the oldest of three from this union. He accepted Christ at an early age and considered himself a Baptist. 

Dean graduated from Flint Northwestern High School in 1973 and shortly after, he served in the United States Air Force as a Sergeant, a skilled carpenter, and also a boy scout leader, which isn't surprising since he loved kids. He was honorably discharged in 1979.

While stationed in Indian Springs, NV he later met the love of his life, Debra Faye (Spencer), in 1977 and she became his loyal loving wife on February 25, 1978, and Dean became a loving and devoted father to Rochelle. They remained happily married for 42 years until his passing.

Dean was a jack of all trades and worked many jobs after he retired from the Air Force. Bartending was his natural talent where he worked at Desert Inn and Silver City and was often referred to as ISAAC from the "Love Boat". He then became a cab driver, which he loved and driving while entertaining customers was second nature to him until his passing, although we truly believe he missed his calling as a comedian.

Dean was always the life of the party. With his jokes and philosophies, there was never a dull moment. He was always up for having cocktails and trying new drinks. He was extremely kind, generous, happy, and full of joy with an infectious laugh that touched your spirit. Most importantly EVERYBODY loved and enjoyed his company, especially the nieces, nephews, and friends of the family.


]]>

item.title: Okino Nixon
item.description:
Sunrise: June 1, 1964     Sunset: April 28, 2020
Herbert Leon Nixon was born on June 1, 1964 in Los Angeles, California to August and Helen Nixon. As early as eleven he was placed in the spotlight by The Young Saints Scholarship Foundation, a nonprofit youth organization in Los Angeles. Herbert debut solo vocal performance with The Young Saints was televised on a local network and there was not a dry eye backstage or in the audience. The skills and discipline he learned with The Young Saints, the woodcraft Rangers, piano and tennis lessons with his grandmother Dora Belle Ansley, and every other program she kept him involved in played a major role in his development as a young man.
He attended Dorsey High School, Los Angeles, California in the 10th grade  and joined the ROTC, we were certain he was headed for the military after graduation, but he had other plans. He was accepted to Birmingham High School, Van Nuys, California and immediately joined the marching band playing the bass and snare drum. Marching band was his whole world in high school along with his two best friends Ernest and Joe they were unstoppable. Herbert graduated from Birmingham High in 1982.
He loved to play his drum in his room, build go-carts, and spend most of his time learning something new, or creating something new. Herbert had an "I can teach myself anything attitude". 
In the 90's Herbert legally changed his name to Okino Kegali Nixon to his dad he will always be "Drop" but we all know he called himself "Uncle Elroy".
He obtained a California Real Estate License, a California Barber License, and Nevada HVAC Certification, he taught himself to speak spanish by listening to audio cassettes, and even took Helicopter flying lessons. He worked for Bank of America, Los Angeles, California and Los Angeles Unified School District prior to relocating to Las Vegas, Nevada.
]]>

item.title: Morzell & Minnie Walker
item.description:
Morzell Walker -  Sunrise: December 31, 1942   Sunset: March 31, 2020
Minnie Walker -  Sunrise: February 17, 1945   Sunset: April 4, 2020 
Morzell Walker was born December 31, 1942, in Carthage, Arkansas, to the late Sampson and Ulah Ann Walker. He was the second of six children; one brother, James, preceded him death. 

He attended elementary and high school in Carthage, Arkansas, where he was a member of the basketball team. Upon graduation, Morzell moved with his family to Las Vegas, Nevada, in 1961. His work history included Silver Nugget, Hacienda Hotel, EG&G, and Hamburger Heaven before retiring from the Clark County School District as lead custodian after more than 30 years. He was married to the former Minnie L. Stewart, in 1969. To this union was born two children, Colean and Deano. He was a devoted husband, father and grandfather. 

Morzell loved to hunt and fish, although his declining health over the years had not allowed him to pursue this passion. He also loved to bake and was often called on to make one of his mouthwatering confections. He loved spending time with his grandchildren, often babysitting and just hanging out. He was baptized at an early age at the Lea's Ridge Missionary Baptist Church in Lea's Ridge, Arkansas. Upon his death he was a faithful member of the Living World Church of God in Christ under the leadership of Pastor L.H. Murray, where he served as a deacon. 

Minnie Lee Stewart was born on February 17, 1945 in Goshen Springs, Mississippi to the late Corena and Cordell Stewart. Her early education took place at Chapman School in Leesburg, Mississippi. She also attended Sand Hill High, in Sand Hill, Mississippi. She was a member at Oak Grove Missionary Baptist, in Leesburg, Mississippi where she was baptized and accepted the Lord Jesus Christ as her Lord and Savior at an early age.  Shortly thereafter, she and her sister Cora (Kate) began singing duets in the surrounding churches. 

She moved to Las Vegas, Nevada in 1965 where she attended the Dana McKay Business College. She soon met and married Morzell Walker in 1969. To this union were born two children, a daughter Colean Marcielle Walker, and a son, Deaniak Shonnon Walker. 

Her employment history in Las Vegas, NV included The Sands Hotel, Nellis Air Force Base, EG&G, and the Department of Energy where she served for more than thirty years before she retired. She was a member of the American Business Woman Association of America, and Seniors Walking Across America at the Pearson Community Center in Las Vegas, Nevada. Minnie (Deannie) was also an active volunteer with the food bank at Living Word Ministry COGIC, a choir member, and an usher under the leadership of Pastor Lawrence H. Murray. 

As if that wasn't enough to keep her busy, some of her hobbies included, walking, sewing, singing, collecting antiques, coffee mugs, and photographs of her family members and friends. In years past, she sang with the former quartet group, the Deliverance Singers and the Gospel Music Workshop of America. Minnie (Deannie) also sang with two other local choirs, Las Vegas District Choir, and Nevada first Ecclesiastical Jurisdictional Choir. One of the highlights of her life were the big  Sunday dinners at her home, particularly the Easter Family Dinner. It was a delight for her to cook and serve others. She also enjoyed spending time with her grandchildren. She liked traveling, especially driving across country with her family where they would sometimes stop at the Antique Road Shows. She also liked attending National COGIC Conventions. 


]]>

item.title: Khiri Bryant
item.description:
Sunrise: April 25, 1996      Sunset: April 1, 2020
Khiri Harris Bryant, affectionately known as RIRI or Big Guy to his aunt Pat was born on April 25,1996 to Erricka Nicole Jackson and Grover Harris Bryant, Hr. at UCSD Medical Center in San Diego, CA. Khiri was their first child and although born prematurely Khiri proved to be a natural born fighter.
 To know Khiri was to truly love him. Khiri had a smile that could warm hearts. His undying loyalty and heart of gold set him far apart from others. Just upon First glance you could tell that Khiri was truly special. Early on Khiri loved to draw, it was exciting watching him create his little masterpiece, it showed exactly what a complex and interesting person he was becoming. one thing that stood out at a young age about Khiri was his drive to succeed. Khiri had a sharp and motivated entrepreneurial spirit that unmatched at his age.
 Khiri was the first son to Grover and the two of them shared equally amazing qualities. Tall, Handsome,Loyal,Strong,protective and without to mention hilarious. Khiri was with out doubt his Daddy's son but held tight to his Mama's boy title. Being the oldest of 5 he was also a protector and at times a provider to his younger brothers and sisters. His love for his family and friends was genuine, unparalleled and pure. 
Khiri was lucky in love,and finally found the one ins his beautiful girlfriend, Taylor Biddle. all stars in the galaxy couldn't match the love that he felt for his soulmate. Taylor brought out the best in Khiri and at the time of his unfortunate passing Khiri was committed to changing his life to suit their needs.
]]>

item.title: Charles Vailes Jr.
item.description:
Sunrise: December, 13 1999     Sunset: March, 28 2020
Charles Andrew Vailes Jr. was born in Las Vegas, Nevada to Charles Andrew Vailes Sr. and Kristal McClodden on December 13, 1999 at University Medical Center. C'Jaay was a good baby from birth. He never gave us any problems. He would sleep through the night. C'Jaay earned his nick name "Bubbles/Bubbs" because of his big, bright eyes. Everyone loved him. As he grew older becoming a toddler, he loved his shoes. Bubbles loved to dress himself and would always ask for his shoes to be cleaned. He was predestined to be into fashion. C'jaay started his educational journey in Pre-K at Head Start.  He started his first elementary school in the Clark County School District at Halle Hewetson Elementary School. C'Jaay later transferred to Howard Wasden Elementary School. He continued to Leavitt Middle School and then Centennial High School. C'Jaay earned his High School diploma graduating from Cimmaron Memorial High School May 2018. Although he was a Centennial Bulldog at heart. 

C'Jaay accepted Jesus Christ as his personal Savior at a young age. He was baptized at Second Baptist Church under the leadership of Pastor Willie Davis. C'Jaay participated in the youth ministry as well as Vacation Bible School. Later on, C'Jaay, his mother and siblings joined Fresh Wind Ministries, under the leadership of Pastor Paul & Yolanda Kelker in 2015. C'Jaay expressed that he was introduced to a new way of learning about God which made him want to go to church. He participated in the youth program called Generation Now. He had the opportunity to participate in the "Reset, Revive, Restart" which was a great success impacting our youth. 

C'Jaay played Pop Warner Football for the Steelers and the Colts. He trained for boxing at the Richard Steele Gym. C'Jaay loved music from a toddler and began singing. 

There was an extra room with an old computer which he somehow figured out how to download software and record himself. So his mother went and bought him a microphone to plug into the computer. He would record himself everyday all day. C'jaay was not an engineer but loved bass. So, when he recorded himself he would put so much that the bass would vibrate through his voice. He began his music career in 2010 by turning his thoughts into catch phrases. As his mother, he was encouraged to be whatever he wanted to be. That's when he unleashed the inspiration he kept bottled up from his then rapper mom & her long time boyfriend. He turned his room completely into a home studio and began recording track after track in his closet. One day he stumbled upon a track that he knew had to be recorded in a quality studio. In 2014 C'Jaay performed the same song & was the winner of his first live performance/talent show, "Apollo in the Desert". 

The following were his stage names ASVP Verbz, C'Jaay Tha Prince and Luccy2x

Luccy2x was born in the center of entertainment capitol of the world, destined to be in the spotlight. Full of personality and drive he continued to push his intense flow through Las Vegas underground scene. He signed as an artist with "No Lackin ENT" May of 2019. 

"I wasn't homeless or nothing, but I didn't come from too much so I rap about nice things that I'm gonna make sure I have & I want people to witness the finished product of my struggle. Plus I want my queen to reap the benefit of my appreciation of her continuous hard work & support." -Luccy2x--

C'Jaay loved his family, especially his siblings. He believed in sticking together no matter what. On January 4, 2020 C'Jaay became a loving father to K'Lani Amor Vailes, who he nicknamed "Baby K". C'Jaay was a firm believer in giving back. He fed the homeless, participated in back to school events and took advantage of every opportunity to participate in community events. 
]]>

item.title: Rachelle Charolette Williams
item.description:
Sunrise: June 12, 1980    Sunset: March 26, 2020
Rachelle Charlotte Williams was born June 12, 1980 to Ray Charles and Bertha M. Williams in Las Vegas, Nevada. Rachelle was the third of four children born to this union and she was affectionately known as Ray Ray or Ray. She was very close to her father, Ray Charles and was a true Daddy's girl.

Rachelle received her formal education from Las Vegas Academy where she was a Choir major and studied singing. Rachelle accepted Christ as her Lord and Savior at an early age and was united with Greater Faith Baptist Church under the leadership of the late Pastor Earl Henry Sr. 

Rachelle accepted her calling to preach and was ordained as an Associate Pastor in 2018 under the leadership of Pastor Jerry L. Page. At Greater Faith Baptist Church, Rachelle wore many hats. Rachelle was the youth pastor, Honorary Usher, Choir Director, member of the Praise Team, and she led many songs. Rachelle was committed to her church and was a faithful member. Rachelle assisted her Pastor when needed by conducting church service and teaching bible study. Rachelle was a powerful Minister and used her calling to spread the Word of God Around the community every chance she got. Rachelle was also a Gospel Recording Artist with Evangelist Althea Brown and Friends and she sang with various groups throughout the city to include: Angels of Faith, Just for Christ and Friends of Gospel. Rachelle was everything to many people and she was well known throughout the Las Vegas Valley church community.  Rachelle was employed by Clark County Department of Family Services-Safe at home program in Las Vegas, Nevada until her health failed. Rachelle was praised by her co-workers as being helpful and friendly. Her Manager, Brenda Barnes, say "Rachelle was my rock. Without her talents, support and friendship we wouldn't have been able to assist as many families in the community as we had". Rachelle loved God, her family and church family. No matter what was going on Rachelle always had a smile on her face.
]]>

item.title: Nikeea Coleman
item.description:
Sunrise: April 23, 1981    Sunset: March 22, 2020
Nikeea Charmaine Coleman was born to Reverend Chuck and Cheryl Coleman on April 23, 1981 at Women's Hospital in North Las Vegas Nevada. Nikeea, also known as KeKe or Keea, attended Ruth Fyfe Elementary School, Gibson Jr. High School and Community College High School. Nikeea graduated from Community College High school in 1999. Prior to becoming a mother, Nikeea attended College of Southern Nevada, where she was pursuing a career in criminal justice.

Nikeea was known for singing, dancing taking pictures and was a true foodie. She hugged everyone that she came into contact with and was extremely lovable. Nikeea refused to let her diabetes, heart conditions, and other other medical challenges keep her from becoming the self sufficient women she was. Nikeea was devoted daughter, who took pride in making sure that her mother was taken care of. Nikeea enjoyed spending time with her mother and father and was a bonafide daddy'd girl. 

Nikeea loved her brothers and sisters. She shared a unique bond with each of them. DeShone was Nikeea's safe place and she knew that her sister was only a phone call away. Denice was Nikeea's road dog and hype man who had her back no matter what. Byron and Chuck Jr. were her protectors. Nikeea gave her life to Christ at an early age. Her favorite saying was "but God" and she prayed relentlessly. At the time of her death she was a member of New Paradise Baptist Church under the leadership of the late Pastor Earl Henry. 
]]>

item.title: Willie Cornelius
item.description:
Sunrise: July 18, 1945    Sunset: March 6, 2020
Willie Clinton Cornelius was born to the late Clinton and Lula Belle Cornelius on July 18, 1945 in Adel, Ga. He departed this earthly life on Friday, March 6, 2020. He was preceded in death by brother: John Cornelius of Lake Wales, FL and sister: Shirley Mathis of Spark, GA. 

He was a man of many talents and strengths. An innovator, explorer, and a pioneer who moved by his own will as he courageously pursued many opportunities of travel, entrepreneurship, and various life pursuits. 

Willie/Joe/Clint/Corne/Cornelius was as multifaceted as his many names. He was loved, adored, and awed by family, friends, co-workers, and those who came into contact with him. He wooed with his charm, dazzled with his beautiful side smile, made you take notice to his words and deeds with his bold and no nonsense stature, that brought an umbrella of protection to many loved ones. 

He availed himself to churches, lodges, and veteran service organizations within the community. He held a leadership position within the Clark County School District Support Services Union where he fought for the rights of many. He was the family proclaimed historian who shared wonderful stories of old. 
]]>

item.title: Roger Mayweather
item.description:
Sunrise: April 24, 1960     Sunset: March 17, 2020
Roger was born in Grand Rapids, Michigan on April 24,1960 to Bernice and Theartha Mayweather. He leaves to cherish his memories, daughter Jade Mayweather, son LehKei Mayweather and a bonus son Mike Cutright. Three sisters Anna (Sonny) Jacobs, Eloise (Lloydell) Harris and Jackie Mayweather, Life-Long friends and caregivers Otis Pimpleton Jr. and Boza Edwards, a host of nieces, and nephews, family and friends. 
 
He was preceded in death by his mother and father, sister Dorothy "Dot" Mayweather and brother Theartha "Thee" Mayweather
As an adolescent Roger was always a feisty soul and little did anyone know his dominant personality coupled with his determination to not be mediocre would lead him to stardom.
Roger begun boxing at the age of 16 and quickly begun to compete and excel in amateur bouts, Golden Gloves, state and national competitions. 

By the time he was 20, he moved to Las Vegas where he turned pro shortly thereafter. By age 21, he solidified his first boxing and the greats before him. He was quick to tell reporters and whomever challenged his boxing intellect, ''you don't know shit about boxing!" this quote will be forever etched in our memories and within the boxing community as a whole. 

Although he retired his gloves in 1999, he picked up the hand pads and is acknowledged today as the best to ever do it. During his training career, he worked with many champions such as Oscar De La Hoya, Lailah Ali and his undefeated nephew Floyd Mayweather Jr. but he was just as passionate about training our youth.

When Roger was not in the gym, he was busy being a devoted father. His children meant the world to him. He literally shopped for them every day, packed lunches for school, attended his daughter tennis matches, played basketball with his son, took them to the movies, amusements parks and wherever their little hearts desired. Roger also enjoyed skating, shooting pool and giving back to the less fortunate.
 
After a long bout of illness, our beloved Roger was called home on March 17, 2020. He fought a  good fight and will be missed dearly by his children, family, friends and the entire boxing community
]]>

item.title: Robert Rogers Jr.
item.description:
Sunrise: January 23, 1961    Sunset: February  26, 2020 
On January 23, 1961, in the city of Monroe, the state of Louisiana received a wonderful gift, a baby boy born to Robert and Mary_Lacraze Rogers, whom they named Robert Rogers, Jr. Robert received his education in the Madison Parish School District, attending Wright Elementary School, McCall Jr. High School, and graduated from McCall Sr. High School in 1980. 

Robert confessed his belief in Christ as his Lord and Savior at an early age at Palestine Missionary Baptist Church in Tallulah, Louisiana. 

Robert moved to Las Vegas in 1987. He was a man who never wanted to be unemployed. He worked at Southwest Medical Center as a Surgical Technician, American Medical Response Maintenance supply technician and his last employment was with the Clark County School District at Clark High School. 

In January, 2011, Robert re-united with love of his life, Linda Griffin. They were married the same year. Om the afternoon of February 26, 202 Robert transition.
]]>

item.title: Edna Earl Bright
item.description:
Sunrise: October 23, 1945                Sunset:March 14, 2020
Edna Early Bright was born October 23,1945  to Abraham & Bessie (hickman) Smith, in Winston County, Mississippi. She attended Thomas Town High School. Edna, at an early age gave her life to christ & was baptized in madison Parson.
In 1964, Edna met the love of her life jessie Bright Jr., whom she affectiontely called BRIGHT. They married in 1955 & together they built their life in N.L.V. Edna & Jessie were married for 31 yearsuntil his passin in 1994. From this union, they were blessed with five Children, three preceded in her death.
Edna worked as a dealer at several hotels on the Las Vegas Strip. she had many interests, she loved reading the bible & listeing to ghosple music. she had a passion for gardening & red roses were her favorite. she loved outdoors and going on walking. she had a love for sports, shopping & the family feud was her favorite show.
Edna was a devoted wife, mother, grandmother, & great grandmother.

item.title: Pastor Earl Henry Sr.
item.description:
Sunrise: January 3, 1955     Sunset: February 28, 2020
Pastor Earl Henry Sr.  was born on January 3, 1955, to the Union of Sam Henry and Myrtis Latchinson-Henry, in Sicily Island, Louisiana, where he was raised and Baptized at an early age. Earl attended public school at Sicily Island High School, where he graduated, class of 1973. He always said, "We worked in the cotton field half of the year and went to school the other half of the year." After graduation, Earl made a conscious decision to relocate from Louisiana to Las Vegas, NV, where he planted his feet on 'Solid Ground'. 

Shortly after arriving to Las Vegas, NV, he acquired a job at the Central Telephone Company. Not long after arriving in Las Vegas, he sent for his high school sweetheart Nancy Hatten and they married January 17, 1974. Through this union, 4 (four) beautiful children were born. 

He united with New Light Missionary Baptist Church under the leadership of Pastor John Henry Jr. He sang in the choir and helped Pastor John Henry in whatever he needed him to do. In 1979, God called Earl to preach and evangelize his word, after the loss of their second child. Four years after stepping into ministry, God elected Earl to his first Pastoral position at Greater Faith Baptist Church. In the midst of Pastoring and parenting, Pastor Henry decided to extend his education. Pastor Henry obtained an Associate of Art Degree in Business Administration from Western University which is a branch of the University of Phoenix Association. He said, " I wanted to wait for my kids to finish school, before I went back to school. Pastor Henry Pastored Greater Faith Baptist Church for 28 years, until God saw the need to transition him for the birth of New Paradise Missionary Baptist Church. Despite being a full-time Pastor, Pastor Henry steadily worked for 45years; 41 of those year were dedicated to working the 'grave-yard' shift at what's now called "Century Link Telecommunications."
Pastor Henry retired from his illustrious career in January of 2019 to place all of his focus on his baby " New Paradise Missionary Baptist Church." Pastor Henry, developed numerous quotes and his most memorable quotes were: "It's in your Bible if you didn't tear it out and God is so big if he moved, he'd bump into himself." His most memorable quote for New Paradise was, Working Together Works! 
 Pastor Henry was a very humble, kind, and hardworking man. His family was his proudest accomplishment who he boasted upon and loved dearly. His favorite work phrase was "if there is a job to do, stay with it until it's done." He will be remembered for his canny sense of humor, flawless love of people, and unwavering commitment to the Lord! Pastor Henry remained the Shepperd of the New Paradise Missionary Baptist Church until God saw fit to call him home, February 28, 2020, as he transitioned peacefully at his home, built for his wife and children.
]]>

item.title: Eugene Shaw
item.description:
Sunrise: August 19, 1954     Sunset: February 25, 2020
  Eugene ''Sweets'' Shaw was born on August 19,1954 to Johnnie and Bertha (Wells) Shaw in Las Vegas, Nevada.Eugene was the only son. He was proceeded in death by his parents.
  Eugene attended and graduated from Las Vegas High. While in high school. Eugene gave his life to Christ at an early age at  Pilgrim Rest M.B Church. Eugene later joined St. Paul COGIC church in Las Vegas, Nevada where he served as a deacon.
In 1977, Eugene (Sweets) training as an apprentice and joined the international Brotherhood of Electrical Workers (IBEW) 357.
  Eugene married & divorced Lola Gaston. 
Eugene later fell in love and married his best friend Katrina Brown ans was very happy until his death. 
After retiring from IBEW, Eugene enjoyed working with Evolution Travel. He also loved traveling, spending time with family and friends, giving back to the community, helping veterans and seniors. Eugene was a loving and caring person. 
  Eugene loved his wife, children, family and his Shih Tzu Bella Rose.

item.title: David Willis Levi
item.description:
Sunrise: January 31, 1986     Sunset: February 23, 2020
David Levi reported to duty on January 31, 1986, in Las Vegas, Nevada to John Neil Levi and Margaret Turner. David was know as Gino. David (Gino) was baptized and accepted Christ at an early age at Holy Cross MBC which later he joined the Holy Cross Solid Rock MBC both under the leadership of Pastor G.L Turner. He really enjoyed the choir, his favorite song were "Blessed Like That" & "Whatever You Need" you could hear him singing almost louder than the choir. David loved his Pastor words, Little Prayer Little Power, No Prayer No Power. David would make his way to the altar for prayer every Sunday. David attended Kit Carson ES, Vegas Veredes ES, West Prep MS and Horizon North High School. David enjoyed cooking for his family. His favorite signature meal which everyone loved was the famous Atomic Signature chicken wings and outdoor barbequing. He was named " Chef Boy Gino". David was an amazing father, son, brother, uncle, cousin and friend. He loved his family and made sure you knew it. He loved all family gatherings, holiday, rapping and telling his jokes. He had two sayings, You Better knock it Off, and Get there in Joel Levi voice.

item.description:

item.title: Willie Gatlin
item.description:
Sunrise: September 15, 1930     Sunset: February 2, 2020
BORN TO THE UNION OF MS.CORA AND WILL GATLIN, A BABY BOY  ON SEPTEMBER 15, 1930 IN MAGNOLIA, ARKANSAS WILLIE GATLIN.  WILLIE GREW UP IN MAGNOLIA AND ENTERED THE ARMY ON JUNE 1, 1952-54 DURING THE KOREAN WAR.  WILLIE CLIMBED THE MASONIC LODGE TO BE ELEVATED TO A 32ND DEGREE MASON BEFORE HIS DEMISE. 

HE FOUGHT A GOOD FIGHT BUT SUCCUMBED TO A PNEUMONIA VIRUS AT MOUNTAIN VIEW HOSPITAL ON FEBRUARY 2, 2020 HIS NINETIETH YEAR, WILLIE TRAVELED AND LIVED IN ST. LOUIS MISSOURI AND CALIFORNIA, THEN MOVED TO LAS VEGAS, NEVADA IN 1970 AND LIVED HERE UNTIL HIS HOME GOING. 

WILLIE ENJOYED PLAYING DOMINOES AND CARDS AND HIS FAVORITE CARD GAME WAS BID WHIST HE PLAYED ON SATURDAYS AT THE PEARSON CENTER.  WAITING TO MEET HIM IN GLORY HIS MOTHER AND FATHER. SISTERS AND BROTHERS. 

IF YOU HEAR ABOUT MY HOME GOING DON'T WORRY ABOUT ME. PLEASE REMEMBER GOD HAS SET ME FREE NO MORE PAIN, NO MORE SUFFERING, NO MORE WORRIES I AM FREE. 

HE JOINED THE BREAD OF LIFE MINISTRY AND MORNING INTERCESSORY PRAYER GROUP, HE WAS AFFECTIONATELY CALLED "DAD" BY MANY AND REMEMBERED FOR HIS PRAYER BEGINNING "HEAVENLY FATHER'

Gerome Beatty married Rosie Lee in 1968. Then to Kirstine in 1986. he Later married Almadene, all in Las Vegas Nevada. item.title: La Vern Brown
item.description:
Sunrise: October 2, 1942                Sunset: February 4, 2020
La Vern Brown was born on October 2,1942 in Lake, MS to Denham and Winnie Johnson.
La Vern graduated from Sherman Hills High School in 1961. She continued on to TJ Harris College in Meridian, MS on a Basketball Scholarship from 1961-1962. She led her team to the State Championship in 1961 and many said if the WNBA was in existence she would have been drafted.

La Vern moved to Los Angeles, CA in 1962 where she stayed for a few months before moving to Las Vegas where she made this her home for 58 years. She married James Brown Sr. and to this union two sons were born.

La Vern was employed at central Telephone Company for many years and she quickly transitioned from Public Relations to Engineer. She was a very hard worker and proud of her accomplishments. 
La Vern enjoyed sewing and planting in her garden in her spare time. Her favorite flower was the Mississippi Magnolia.

  Falishia Grew up in Las Vegas, Nevada with her family. She attended Lincoln Elementary School, Jim Bridger Middle School, Bonanza High School, and later went to Clark High School. Falishia had two children  whom she was a devoted mother to, Daughter Diamond Tanner and Son Cody Butler.

Falishia knew and loved the lord. She was Baptized at a young age at  Pilgrim Rest Baptist Church. She worked in the food and beverage industry for many years. She also worked in the home health care before her passing. She was a very creative person who loved music, fashion, design, and interior decorating. item.title: Zena Thomas
item.description:
Sunrise: December 7, 1959                  Sunset: January 15, 2020
Zena Yvonne Thomas was born on December 07,1959 in Las Vegas Nevada. From the union of Mae and Willie Strong, Zena became the second of six children. As a young girl, Zena was shy and a very sweet girl, who found great joy in reading, baking, and sewing. During her youth, Zena along with her parents and siblings, traveled and live in Del Rio Texas and Okinawa, Japan. Zena started school in Las Vegas and later moved to Del Rio, Texas, Where she studied Cosmetology. Prior to her to her senior year ending the Strong family relocated back to Las Vegas, Nv. Upon graduating from Vo-Tech High School in 1978, She accepted employment through the Economic Opportunity Board (EOB), where she worked as a secretary. Zena Has a special group of church friends that would frequently travel around Las Vegas and California to attend midnight musicals. She often shared how much fun and adventurous those times were. 

Years later, Zena became employed by Nevada Power (NV Energy). in 1985, While Employed at Nevada Power, she met Wornzie L. Thomas (affectionately known as Thomas). They married on Valentines Day in 1990. IN 1995, Thomas and Zena decided to move their family to his home town in Selma, Alabama. While in Selma, Zena worked at Pioneer Electric and later she and her family joined Gospel Tabernacle church of God and Christ under the leadership of Pastor John E. Grayson. There she served as a Sunday School teacher, Choir President, and a Church Sectary, because of her beautiful spirit. Zena made many close friends that turned into family who could all attest to her low temperance and her sweet, beautiful spirit. Zena was the epitome of various a women.

In 2003, Zena and her family relocated back to Las Vegas Nv, where she continued her faithful membership at  Vegas view Church of God and Christ, serving under the leadership of Pastor Jerald J. Manson I and the late first lady Marguerite Jean Manson. During this membership Zena worked as a youth Sunday School teacher. In Zena's spare time, she loved caring and spending quality time with her family and friends. Zena rarely complained and whatever was required or asked of her . she did it with a smile. When it came to working or helping others, it was hard for her to say no. In 2008 , Thomas, Zena and Jasmine moved to Hazelehurst, Mississippi to look and care after her aunt (Thelma Strong). Zena often said '' She felt it was the lord led her to do so''.
]]>

item.title: Paul Knox
item.description:
Sunrise: September 8, 1923                 Sunset: January 8, 2020
Paul Emerson Knox was born September 8, 1923 to the late Glascoe and Arlo Knox in Chicago Illinois.
Paul has six siblings who preceded him in death; Westley, Maxine, Betty, Jeanne, Ester, and John. He has one living sibling, Richard who resides in Detroit, Michigan.

Paul started education in the Detroit School system and later relocated to Indianapolish, where he obtained a high school diploma. After high school, Paul enlisted in the U.S Army. he served as a photographer and a skilled carbine marksman. During his service, he traveled to many countries; such as Italy,Germany, and Switzerland. he received numerous accolades including; The Good Conduct Medal, World War II Victory Medal and with his Honorable discharge, he received the World War II Service Lapel Pin. After his tenure in the army, Paul moved to Los Angeles, California. he worked as a skilled carpenter and joined the union. As a union member,he was afforded the opportunity to help develop his community by assisting the major projects. Some of the developments were Bank of America, First Interstate Bank, and Southwest College. He was also an entrepreneur and owned a dry cleaner, a service station,and income property.

Paul married Catherine and with this union, there were five children, Tyrone, Dannelle,Paul Jr., who proceeded him in death, Michael, and Lydia. He provided Unconditional love and affection to his family.he was a devoted husband and father who always supported and participated in his children's lives

He remarried Irma and became a father to her two children from her previous marriage, Sylvia and Vincent.They enjoyed traveling and spending time with family. later they relocated to Las Vegas.

Paul joined the Los Angeles American Legion and served as Treasury and Finance Chairman. as the finance chairman, he balanced the budget and was instrumental in accomplishing the organization financial goal. he also joined the American Legion in Las Vegas 

He loved horse racing. He frequently attended Hollywood Park and Santa Anita racetracks. He was an expert Auctioneer. His second passion was his music and enjoyed harmonious sounds of the organ. So, he purchased as organ and took lessons. Paul had an awesome voice and would sing as he played. He will be remembered for not the jack,but the master of all trades. Simply because he was a painter, a mechanic, a computer tech, an appliance repairman and landscaper:you name it he could fix it. He also known for his finger-licking good barbeque and firework display. 
]]>

Ellen Reed was born on September 4,1939 to Mary Ida James and Frank Williams who preceded her in death.
Ellen was the oldest of 8 children, she attended Tensas Parish School. She married Joe Reed who has preceded her in death. Ellen was Baptized at an early age. she moved to Las Vegas in 1963 where she worked at the flamingo  hotel as a laundry worker. she joined Grace Emmanuel Baptist church under the leadership of late pastor Alexander, later joined St. John Baptist Church under leadership of late Pastor Perkins  where she remained until her death. She is preceded in death by her bother Saul Williams, Sister Mary Louis William, 3 grandchildren and a nephew.

item.title: Brenda Banks
item.description:
Sunrise: April 22, 1947            Sunset: January 6, 2020
A Bright-eyed Brenda  Joyce was born to Clifford and Geraldine Porter on friday April 22,1947 in Las Vegas, Nevada. Brenda was reared in the heart of historic Westside's black community. Her villiage then was experiencing  exponential growth as well as religious,social, cultural, business, and community development. She was among close family and friends who attended Westside Grammer School at Washington and D Streets Las Vegas. After grammar school she attended Madison Middle School (Currently known as Wendell P. Williams Elementary) and graduated from Western High School in 1965. Her education continued through Southern Nevada Memorial Hospital (Currently University Medical Center) where she became a Licensed Practical Nurse.

Brenda worked for Sunrise Hospital for over 20 years and remained in the medical field. She obtained a Personal Care Profession Certification whereby she provided in home car for number of years before her retirement. Her continuous dedication to medical scholarship enabled her to naturally and unconditionally respected matriarch. Brenda was married to Earl Gene Banks in 1973, and she was devoted to this union more than two decades. She loved the lord with all her heart and soul.

Brenda was an independent thinker who expressed her opinion candidly, and those who knew her were fortunate to call her friend and family. She was notably a sticker for impeccable cleanliness and organization. she enjoyed the sport of tennis as well as gardening and cooking. she was also an avid reader of literature and history.

]]>

item.title: Willie Strong
item.description:
Sunrise: March 18, 1938            Sunset: January 5, 2020
Willie Strong was born on March 18th, 1938 in Hazlehurst, Mississippi to the late Reverend Samuel Strong & Janie L. Chapman Strong. Willie is the only son of two children. Willie attended Mount Canaan Grammar School and was graduated of Parrish High School in 1956. After High School Willie moved to Louisiana, where he took in a Furniture company and thought it to be too laborious and back breaking so on July 1st, 1958, he made a decision to enlist in the United States Air Force. Willie joined the USAF without being drafted. After returning from a tour in Vietnam he was stationed at Nellis Air Force Base where he met Mary Virginia Manson. Willie and Mae {Mary Virginia} married on January 31st, 1964. During Willies Military career as an Aircraft Mechanic he held the top position  as a Zero-Defect Mechanic. Due to his career choice in the Air Force , Willie  traveled with is wife and his children to live over seas in Okinawa, Japan,and a lengthy duty assignment at Laughlin Air Force Base in Del-Rio, Texas. On July 1st,1978 after 20 years of Successful service Willie retired at NAFB. Upon retiring from the military in 1978, Willie worked as a Cable Splicer for Cox Communications formerly Misco Cable for an additional 20 years.

Willie accepted the Lord as his personal savior fifteen years ago at the end of the year revival. He joined his wife and children who were already members of Vegas View Church of God in Christ and faithfully served under the leadership of Pastor Jerald J. Manson,I, as Head Deacon, Trustee Board member, Vice President of Men's fellowship, and Food Bank Worker.

Willie loved to return home to Hazlehurst, Mississippi to visit his family and childhood friends. He found great jot in working around his sister's home and his family's property. He was fondly known as ''Doll Brother'' a nickname giving to him by his sister Thelma. Willie was known as a modern day MacGyver. Willie possessed a genius-level intellect, superb Engineering skills, excellent knowledge  od applied physics, military training in Aircraft Mechanic and a preference for non-lethal resolution to conflicts. In short, Willie could fix anything.
   
Willie told tall fables to his children and grandchildren of how he drowned a fish, whooped a bear, and choked an alligator. These funny stories among many others will always be fondly remembered.
]]>

item.title: Jarron McCraney
item.description:
Sunrise: January 21, 1987              Sunset: December 30, 2019
Jarron Lamar McCraney was the first born child to Chenise McCraney on January 21st,1987. Jarron was Born and Raised in Las Vegas, Nevada before entering the workforce. He worked at Various companies, Western States, Bighorn Casino, Walgreen's, and Hustler Hollywood.

Jarron always had a smile and witty anecdote for for every occasion. He enjoyed physical fitness and would often exhibit his muscular physique. Jarron was a multifaceted person who did a lot of different things for various individuals. He was everybody's friend. The listener when you need an ear. the Shoulder when you need to cry. the comedian when you needed a laugh; a protector, and so much more. He was loved by everyone with whom he had contact; A soul that we weep for, But who is now at peace.
]]>

item.title: Pamela Davis
item.description:
Sunrise: August 7, 1969               Sunset: January 14, 2020
Pamela Renee Davis was born in Richmond, California on August 7, 1969 to Norris and Betty Jackson. She graduated from Richmond High School in 1987, and later joined the United States Air Force. Pamela toured the bases of Kadena and Luke, Where she was a member of the Honor Guard. She also  served at Yokota, Elmendorf, and officially retired at Nellis Air Force Base. She served her country from 1989-2008, and Honorably retired. She later received her Bachelor of science from the University of Phoenix, majoring in human services.

Pamela enjoyed cooking, music, bowling,and family. Her favorite dishes to cook included seafood gumbo, macaroni and cheese, and banana pudding. She was an old soul, and enjoyed listening to music from Motown era, as well as Neo-Soul. Some of her favorite songs were ''Aint no Stopping Us Now'' By McFadden and whitehead, ''September'' by Earth, Wind, and Fire, and anything by New Edition. Pamela Participated in a bowling league and frequently played board games with her family and loved ones. Pamela was a member of United Baptist Church in Okinawa, Japan.

item.title: Patricia Bell
item.description:
Sunrise: March 19, 1957                Sunset: November 22, 2019
On Friday November 22,2019, at University Medical Center of Southern Nevada, Patricia Ann Bell , Beloved mother of five, was surrounded by a host of loved ones as she was called home by out Lord and Savior. She was 62 years of age

Born in Louisiana to parents Charles and Annie Bell, Patricia graced the world with her presence on March 19,1957.

When Patricia was a young child the family moved to Las Vegas, Nevada, where Patricia would live most of her adult life and be blessed with her five children.

In her early days, Patricia enjoyed traveling back and forth between Nevada and California to be with extended family and loved ones. She would eventually settle for a while in Southern California and work for the Department of Motor Vehicles, but her heart would always have her returning ''home'' to Las Vegas. There were few things in life the she enjoyed more than her family and reading her bible. As she weathered and endured the storms of life, one could not help but to see and admire her tenacity and resilience. She held strong in her faith that god was always with her.
]]>

item.title: Rhonda Harris-Stewart
item.description:
Sunrise: May 14, 1966               Sunset: December 7, 2019
Rhonda was born from the union of the late Willie Howard Harris, Sr. and Charlene Hampton Harris Richardson. one brother William Howard Harris Jr.

Rhonda grew up in Las Vegas, Nevada with her family. she attended Quannah McCall Elementary School, K O Knudson Middle School, and later attended Clark High School. Rhonda met and married Robert Stewart. Their union demised in 2013.

Rhonda was employed by the JW Marriott Hotel up until her passing. She loved spending time with her family and friends. She was a very fun, loving, outspoken, and caring person. She was always the life of the party. She was always laughing and smiling through her pain. Rhonda enjoyed having fun and traveling. 
She also knew and loved the Lord and was a very outgoing person who never met a stranger. She was a phenomenal daughter, niece, mother, grandmother, and sister who loved her family dearly.

item.title: Rona Harvey
item.description:
Sunrise: March 10, 1971     Sunset: October 29, 2019
Rona was loved by many and will truly be missed especially by her family.

Rona was an Usher at Greater New Morning Star MBC and later became a member of Golden Circle GEMS of the Valley and Desert Rose Grand Chapter Order of Eastern Star Prince Hall Affiliation Nevada Jurisdiction, Electa Chapter Number 5. As a member Rona participated in an array of Charitable Centers with donations. Supporting other Chapters in and out of State, Adopting Seniors for a Day, visiting Clark County Schools with School Supplies and underwear for unisex Pre-K and Kindergarten Students. The members participate in an Annual Masonic Angel Tree where students was selected from an adopted school and presented with Gifts and a food Basket, etc....

On Rona's last day she visited with two of her children, Sunni and Gerald, Jasmine and Devante was called and they spoke with their mother, her last words to them was "I Love You"...During visit several pictures were taken with smiles and laughter. As we prepared to leave everyone said good-bye to each other with hugs and kisses and each one said "I love you mama". As I held my daughter's hand kissing her on the cheek and telling her I love you she said "Me too..I love you mom". I said Good bye I will see you early in the morning and my daughter said "Ok goodbye"

item.title: Ruby King
item.description:
Sunrise: April 7, 1928     Sunset: October 22, 2019
Ruby Jean King was born April 7, 1928 to union of Robert King Sr. and Julee King in Morton, Mississippi. She was one of four children.

She went to school and graduated from Scott County Training School and graduated in 1946. In 1954, Ruby moved to Las Vegas, NV following her brothers in pursuit of work and a new life. She landed a job working at one of the casinos on the strip, The Desert Inn. Later on , she transferred to The Sands Hotel, the Hacienda Hotel, and ended up at the Dunes Hotel and Casino as a supervisor in linen control for 30 years and retired.

Ruby was raised in the church and accepted Christ at an early age. She became a member of Second Baptist Church, and later on in life, Ruby moved her membership over to college Park Baptist Church. 

She loved gardening, cooking, combing hair, and especially sewing. Whether it was clothes or quilts, it brought joy to her seeing her family and friends enjoy the fruits of her labor, and the smiles it put on their faces.
]]>

item.title: Danita Harris
item.description:
Sunrise: October 13, 1980    Sunset: October 25, 2019
Danita LaToya Harris was born on October 13, 1980 to Mary Jo Adanandus-Bell and Darnell Lee Harris in Las Vegas, NV. She was the 3rd of four children. She graduated from Chaparral High School in 1999, and attended Marinello Schools of Beauty where she received her license as a Nail Technologist.

She met her sweetheart and the love of her life, Marcu'ces A. McNeal in 1998. They built a long time loving relationship and had three beautiful children, Marcu'cesia Ache' McNeal, Meya Azhane' McNeal and Maurece Darnell McNeal. She was a be-loved mother, daughter, sister, aunt, friend and co-worker.

Danita worked at the Surgical Weight Loss Center for 18 years as a Surgery Scheduler. In July 2018, she started her new job at OptumCare Cancer Care, Breast Cancer Center as a Surgery Scheduler for breast cancer patients until she was called home on October 25, 2019.

Danita was a cheer mom for the Las Vegas Texans and the Las Vegas Nova. She assisted with scheduling all of the performances, organizing fundraisers, bringing snacks and drinks for the girls. She also traveled with the teams for out-of-town games. She attended every practice and love spending the entire day on the football fields watching her girls cheer. In spite of her challenges with breast cancer, she was determined to attend all of the Las Vegas Nova competitions and performances until September 2019.

Danita was a fun, loving and kind-hearted person. She touched the lives of so many and always had a willingness to help everyone that needs a helping hand. She loved her family and was adored by them.
]]>

item.title: Orzine Robinson
item.description:
Sunrise: October 16, 1942     Sunset: September 29, 2019
Orzine Renett Robinson was born on October 16, 1942 in the community of Dudley Lake, AR. to her parents Lee Tom Robinson Sr. and Annie Bea Robinson. Orzine received Christ at a very young age and it never left it never left her. She received her formal education at Wabbaseka High School. Orzine was united in Holy Matrimony to Melvin Thomas Jr. and to this union they had 3 children. Orzine was a loving mother and taught her children the values of life and love in family, friends and the love of Christ. Orzine moved from Arkansas to Chicago where she raised her children with the have and have not standards!!

Orzine also then pursued her career by moving to Los Angeles and the to Las Vegas, Nevada. Orzine worked for the Post Office in Chicago for 12 years before moving her family to Los Angeles, CA. While in California, she worked as a manager in House Keeping for the Western Bonaventure and this is where she found her passion; she was there for over 10 years. Orzine was offered an opportunity to come to Las Vegas in the early 1990's where she continues her second career as a manager for the Luxor; when another opportunity at the "New" Mandalay Bay Resort. She eagerly jumped at it in 1999. She was loved by everyone at the Mandalay Bay and was known as "Mama". (I don't believe that they really knew her name). But her kindness and generosity spoke for itself and she loved the Mandalay Bay with all of her heart and knew everyone. 

Orzine retired at the age of 72 years old because she loved the people so much at the Bay, that she did not want to leave until her age caught up with her. After retiring, mom became a member of Mountaintop Faith Ministries. She loved her Pastor and First Lady so much she became a Senior Eagle and that was the proudest moment of her later life. Reading her word, ministering to others and bringing people to Mountaintop was her mission; she was on fire for the Lord. 

Orzine's hobbies were collecting bells from all over the country and is known to have collected over 1,700 bells!!! She loved playing cards, shopping at thrift stores, decorating, organizing and cleaning. She could spot dirt and dust as small as a mustard seed! And yes, it has to be cleaned immediately!

Orzine loved her family with a passion like no other; when she retired, she was eager ready to visit them.

Orzine will be missed for an eternity because of that smile, her generosity, love and kind spirit. 
]]>

He leaves to cherish his memories to his parents, mother: Leola Sims Cook, father: Jodie Cook, 5 sisters: Angeline Cook, Angie Cook, Doretha Miller, Ella Mae Cook, Flossie Cook, Shirlene Johnson, 6 brothersd: Jodie Jr. Cook, Lewis Cook, Harold Cook, Walter David Cook, Roy Cook, Odie Cook, His children: Marilyn Jordan, Stacie Mitchell, Marcelia Helen, Michelle Thrower, Patriciaa Trimble, Greg Bass, Angie Trimble, Carla Trimble, a host of grandchildren, nieces and nephews. Preceding him in death was his son: Authur Cook Jr.

item.title: Corey Donte Jones
item.description:
Sunrise: July 16, 1991              Sunset: October 17, 2019
Corey Donte Jones, was born July 16, 1991 in Las Vegas, Nevada. He was the son of Carolyn Ann Bass and James Edward Jones. Corey entered into the arms of an all wised and knowledge God on Thursday, October 17,2019.  As a child, Corey attended Full-Gospel Deliverance and as an adult, he attended Ignited Praise Fellowship pastored by pastor Lacey. Corey enjoyed pretending he had a twin brother named Horey. To convince his friends that he had a twin, he would flip his shirt inside out and put it on backwards. He must have done a good job, because his friends believed him for a while. Corey was a very loving son, brother, husband, and friend. As an adult, Corey enjoyed video games, sports, spending time with the family and what he loved most is coming home to eat momma's hot chicken wings. Later in life, he married his beloved wife Keshia Evans-Jones. Always the jokester, when he met his wife, he had her believing that his name was Corey Donte Julius Jones and that the reason he was so dark was because he was Cuban. In this reunion, there were no children.

item.title: Cassandra Jackson
item.description:
Sunrise:  August 5, 1977            Sunset: October 16, 2019
On Wednesday, October 16, 2019, the lord sent an angel of silence and Cassandra made the transition from this world to be at rest in the presence of the lord. Cassandra Denise Jackson was the fourth of seven children born to Mary and Robert Jackson on August 5, 1977 in Las Vegas, NV. At a very young age, she accepted Christ and attended Trinity Life Center. She continued to build her relationship with Christ throughout the years. She attended Fremont middle school and Rancho high school. Cassandra shared most of her adult life with her longtime fiance Greggory Thomas with whom she had one child, Daveon. She worked in the in home health care field for 12 years until she was diagnosed with her illness. She loved helping and taking care of people. In her spare time, she also enjoyed cooking. But most of all, she enjoyed being with her family, especially her children Daveon and Ashley and her grandchildren. Cassandra was always that person her family or anyone else could lean on.

item.title: Floyd Coleman
item.description:
Sunrise: November 2, 1938     Sunset: October 16, 2019
Floyd Coleman graced the world with his presence on November 2, 1938 in Tallulah, Louisiana to the late union of Louis Robinson and Luella Coleman. He accepted Christ at an early age in Tallulah, Louisiana. Floyd attended Wright Elementary , McCall Jr. High and later on he moved to Los Angeles, California and finished school. In 1958 he enlisted in the United States Air Force which received an Medal for Good Conduct, Specialty title "Veh Operator Mr. Coleman serve our country until Honorably discharged in 1964.

While in the Air Force, "Coleman" as we called him, in the early 1960's got station to Nellis Air Base in Las Vegas, Nevada where and then he met Roma Jean Hunt and a child was born Laurie Hunt- Walker in 1961.

Coleman was a member of the Bartenders Culinary Union. He worked and served as a bartender at many establishment. El Rio Club, Loves Cocktail Lounge, Moulin Rouge, Town Tavern and retired from Seven Seas Liquor Department in 2014.

Coleman was a very caring person and showed love to everyone Quan his Grandson was like a son he never had they were two peas in a pot such a loving Father, Grand papa He was so cool and laid back person. . . You never new he had a mean streak unless you step out of your place. Coleman enjoyed being in the comfort of his own home watching old western movies and having cocktails. Coleman passed peacefully away on October 16, 2019.

item.title: Roslyn Brown
item.description:

item.title: Franklyn Verley
item.description:
Sunrise: December 27, 1960                  Sunset: September 28, 2019
Franklyn Gerrard Verley III was born in New York, New York "Harlem USA" on December 27, 1960 to Franklyn Fitzgerald Verley II and Carroll Ann Howell Verley. From the beginning Franklyn was influence by his Jamaican grandparents both of the Howell's and the Verley's. The family sat around the table and told stories of life in Jamaica and the journey to New York. These stories instilled in him a strong commitment to family and community. Franklyn's parents and grandparents also impressed upon him an authentic appreciation of his roots through submerging him in black culture. Franklyn's father taught him how to be a strong black man who balanced education and self-discipline. His mother's love for educating young people inspired Franklyn's love for mentoring young minds. Growing up in Harlem during the 70's and 80's gave him a flair to his personality that only the community could. Franklyn build lifelong relationships that have sustained through the years.

While growing up, Franklyn was a sports enthusiast, he excelled in wrestling and football. In 1985 Franklyn enlisted in the US Marine Corps. Franklyn later went to work for the New York Times. During his 19 years at The Times, he grew his career to become the regional head of distribution, covering all of New York State and surrounding areas. While at The Times, he cultivated even more lifelong friendships. Relationships that he credited as helping increase hi love for journalism and writing.

After relocating to Las Vegas, Franklyn did what came naturally to him....

Franklyn, aka "Verl" started working for the City of Las Vegas in the Parks & Recreation Division over 21 years ago. He acted as an advocate for his team, he is passionate about keeping the team inspired and motivated. And as with every place Frankly goes, he built lifelong friendships and impacted lives. 

Wanting to connect the community and power of mass media back to its historical relevance in the Black community, he set his sights on radio and joined KCEP FM in June of 2000. His NY roots provided "Franklyn G" insights to Rap, Hip-Hop, New Jack swing, Disco, Soul, R&B and Jazz that shaped his style of programming and events. Franklyn developed his experience in various musical formats as part of the KCEP family, yet he was always hoping to create pathways to connect this small desert oasis to the larger Black diaspora though "Black Intelligent talk radio". In 2006, Franklyn developed "Like It Is Radio!" He used this outlet as an opportunity to speak truth to power and birth events such as "Kemet in The Desert", "Men Who Cook", "Emancipation Circle" and countless other community events. Franklyn is also a part of the renowned :Breakdown Crew". During his time in Las Vegas, Franklyn is the recipient of countless certificates, declarations and awards most recently including the Nevada Broadcasters Hall of Fame, Fountain of Hope Community Activism Award and NAACP Legacy Builder Award.

Franklyn leaves a legacy wherever he goes, but this Desert has been impacted by his bold creative community involvement. Weather "F to the Jizzle". "Franklyn G", "Frank-o-domus" or "Student Verley," this city has been challenged to keep this important work alive. He will tell you "there is still work to be done!"
]]>

item.title: Jerald Johnson
item.description:
Sunrise: February 27, 1969     Sunset: September 15, 2019
Jerald Lavelle Johnson was born February 27, 1969 to Dicie Lee Johnson and the Late James Henry Johnson Sr., in Winnsboro, Louisiana. Jerald relocated to Las Vegas, NV, with his family in 1972. Jerald was educated in the Las Vegas area, and received his High School Diploma as he graduated from Las Vegas High School in 1987. Jerald worked many years for Republic Services, The Horseshoe Hotel, and Solar Company of Nevada.

Jerald had a passion for cars, music and a big heart for helping everyone. Jerald loved engaging in many events and socializing with his family & close friends. He was a die hard Pittsburgh Steelers and San Antonio Spurs fan. Jerald was ecstatic about the upcoming birth of his first Grandchild.

item.title: Lillian Robinson-Heckard
item.description:
Sunrise: December 5, 1945     Sunset: September 3, 2019
Lillian was born on December 5, 1945 in Watts, California to the union of James and Edna Heckard. Her family moved to Las Vegas, NV in 1957 where she attended the Westside Elementary School, Madison Elementary School and later J.D. Smith Jr. High. She graduated from Rancho High School. 

The family joined Pilgrim Rest Baptist Church under the leadership of Rev. E.C. Kline where she was baptized during a revival by the late Rev. Tutt.

Over the years, Lillian held various positions in hospitality, employed at the original Town Tavern on Jackson Street, as a school nurse, in the retail industry she worked at Sally's Beauty Supply stores and was also a caregiver and mentor to all of her nieces, nephews, grandchildren and anyone that came in contact with her loving grace. She loved to read, entertain, and dancing were some of her favorite things. 

Later in life, Lillian moved to San Bernardino, CA with her daughter Lawana and granddaughter Winter until her health declined during her stay at the Meadows Ridge Center.

At 73 years old the Lord sent his angels to deliver Lillian to him on Tuesday, September 3, 2019 at 2:00am

item.title: Sharon Harrell
item.description:
Sunrise: January 9, 1966     Sunset: August 28, 2019
Sharon Gisele Harrell (1/9/66) was born and adopted in Las Vegas, NV, by her loving father, Thomas Charles "TC" Harrell (originally from Baton Rouge, LA) and mother, Marie-Claude Mertz (Harrell Ross; originally of France; 11/26/39-6/13/98). Sharon adored her parents and often referred to them with pride as the best parents anyone could possibly have. Soon after Sharon was adopted, TC was deployed to Vietnam, and Sharon and her mother, Marie-Claude, moved to France to live with Marie-Claude's family during his deployment. As a result, French was Sharon's first language, and it was the only language she knew until she returned with both of her parents to live in Las Vegas when she was 5 years old.

Around the age of 12, Sharon was told that she was adopted and that information was available about her birth parents if she ever wished to attempt to make contact. Being very content with her family life and with all the love and warmth from her extended family, she expressed no interest in reaching out until years later. In the meantime, Sharon graduated from Rancho High School in Las Vegas, and she learned all of the skills needed to become an expert in Food Prep and Food Services during her career at Caesars Palace.

During Sharon's adolescent years, TC and Marie divorced, and Marie Claire married Timothy Ross. From this union, Sharon was thrilled and proud to gain her one and only sister, Ja'Lisea Ross, who now survives Sharon along with Ja'Lisea's three children, Gi'Ana Bolin, Jai'La McCree, and Jai'Len Hicks. 

In 1990, Sharon decided to search for and easily found her biological parents, Lorraine Noirot (4/5/42-2/16/08; from northern Michigan and of French descent) and Leroy "Roy" Frasier (7/6/37-12/29/17; of Brooklyn, NY; and wife, Gillian Bowen Frasier). Lorraine and Roy had met while working in the Peace Africa. Sharon's kind and generous spirit overflowed into the Frasier family and they returned her love with grateful hearts for her presence in their lives.

Sharon's mother's (Marie-Claude's) early passing in June 1998 was a great blow to Sharon, and she was determined to remain extremely close to TC and TC's family, especially after several of them came west to Las Vegas and California after Hurricane Katrina. While Sharon had always desired to be a school teacher and gradually completed her classwork to do so, she decided to open a restaurant in 2004 using a family recipe for barbeque sauce that dated back to 1902, and named the restaurant after her father, TC. Sharon was very proud of her father and her family, and she was thrilled to be able to offer employment to friends and family members when they needed it. Sharon was dedicated to maintaining a down-home personal feel that made her customers seem more like family. What was most important to her was what was always most important - family, community, and providing delicious food.

Business grew rapidly and then exploded after a 2007 restaurant reviewing in the Las Vegas Review-Journal, Heidi Knapp Rinella, called TC's barbeque the best barbeque she had tasted in Las Vegas, in which she gave it perfect scores across the board and the following comment: "As for us, we'll invoke TC's motto: 'The way to a person's heart is through the ribs,'" she wrote.

In a recent article, Sharon was quoted as saying, "It just feels good to know that you've touched someone, even if no one else knows about it. We just believe in doing the right thing and being good to people. My family is what inspires me. Family is everything. This restaurant is just an extension of that. You can't teach someone to care about people. It's part of who you are."

Activism, fighting for equality, and helping people in need. That is not just what Sharon did, it was who she was. As a result. TC's World Famous Rib Crib participated in several community events over the years, including providing catering for the Las Vegas Boxing Hall of Fame and the Holy Smoke - Misfit Missionaries group, who help the homeless population living in the tunnels of Las Vegas. She consistently donated hundreds of burgers for the homeless on Sundays. In 2017, the restaurant provided dinner to a weary group of 70 players and staff of the Miami Central rockets high school football team was left stranded by Hurricane Irma in Las Vegas after playing a game against local high school, Bishop Gorman. While waiting for airports to reopen and communication with family members to be restored after the storm, TC's Rib Crib stepped in to provide whatever was needed. Most recently, TC's donated food for forty people at the non-profit event, "Are You the Woman at the Well?", Women's Workshop at the Beacon Center, to help motivate and encourage women who have been victims of domestic violence and abuse.

To satisfy her desire to make an impact on the lives of young people while running the restaurant (instead of teaching), Sharon used every opportunity to mentor dozens of young people who she lovingly referred to as her daughters, little sisters or her little cousins. Consistent with her generous and caring spirit, she cared for her biological mother Lorraine, and her father, TC, until her death in 2008 and his death in 2015.

Some of Sharon's favorite past times were a good comedy show, and good Vegas show, spending time with family, and she LOVED old photographs and scrapbooking. Things that her loved ones will never forget about her include how she always lovingly exclaimed as she burst out into her infectious laughter, "You are crazy!" and "I LOVE YOU!" and how she always made every single friend, play sister/brother, and play cousin BELIEVE that YOU were indeed her FAVORITE of all!

Sharon is survived by tons of nieces, nephews, cousins, and extended family members and friends who adored Sharon more than words can say. WE LOVE YOU SHARON! (and we know that she loves us back!)
]]>

item.title: Omar Collier
item.description:
Sunrise: May 23, 1970     September 1, 2019
Omar "Dwayne" Collier was born May 23, 1970 to his mother, Mary Bell Collier, and father, James Henry Dodson in Chicago, Illinois. His early education began at St. Martins Catholic School and Dewey Elementary. In 1989, he graduated from Tilden High School before attending and earning an associate's degree from Robert Morris College. Omar was adamant about his education. At the time of his passing, he was attending school for real estate. Shortly after high school, he began working for the Northern Trust Bank for nearly a decade. From there, he worked for telecommunications companies Verizon Wireless and U.S. Cellular. In 2009, Omar moved to Las Vegas, Nevada and took a position in medical billing. Prior to his passing, he worked for Hilton Grand Vacations. Omar was a God-fearing man who believed deeply in the power of prayer. At the age of seven, he dedicated his life to Christ after attending St. Paul Church of God in Christ with his mother and grandmother, Arlena Collier. It was this strong faith that he turned to in May of 2019 when he began his battle with a difficult illness. 

Omar Collier died September 1, 2019. Omar was an amazing person who always looked for opportunities to help others. He cared deeply for his family, especially his mother. He had a passion for basketball, martial arts movies and music. At his core, he was a kindhearted man that encouraged others through the example he set with his own life.
]]>

item.title: Mizell Wright
item.description:

Mizell and Mary arrived in Las Vegas, Nevada in 1959, where Mizell began working in the hotel industry as an engineer at Binion's Horseshoe Hotel until he later retired. He found happiness and joy in his family. Mizell was loved and cherished by all who knew him. He will be missed by many forgotten by none. 
]]>

item.title: Catherine Coates
item.description:

Along with her 2 sisters, Catherine overseen her sister's care while in boarding school. Catherine returned to California as a Senior in High School, along with bother of her sisters to Los Angeles, California. Catherine attended Jefferson High School and graduated. Catherine became an even better mother & housewife when she and Henry married September 11, 1975. The family relocated from Los Angeles to Compton, California, where years later found themselves residing in Moreno Valley, California with their daughter Michelle who proceeded them in death in September 2016. Their final residence landed them in Las Vegas, Nevada with their second daughter Melanie until their final days.

Ronnell Stallworth Sr. passed away August 28, 2019. He was born on September 12, 1966 to James and Ruby Stallworth in Panorama City, California. He was the youngest to two brothers. He moved to Las Vegas December 1993. He was a proud member of Canyon Ridge Christian Church.

item.title: Elvira Gilbert
item.description:
Sunrise: May 28, 1952     Sunset: September 2, 2019
Elvira Toldson Gilbert daughter of late Rev. Henry Toldson and Lucille Woods Toldson, was born in Tallulah, Louisiana on May 28, 1952. She departed this life on September 2, 2019.

Elvira was baptized in 1964, at Pleasant Grove M.B. Church under Leadership of the Late L.E. McDaniels. She graduated from Reuben McCall High School in 1970. Elvira lived in Las Vegas for 27 years and for many years she was a member of Tried Stone Baptized Church under the Leadership of Pastor Ronnie Smith. Then she decided to move to West Monroe Louisiana in 2007 where was a member at Mt. Olive M.B. Church in Tallulah, Louisiana under the leadership of Pastor Terry Moore. item.title: Clinton Brown Jr.
item.description:
Sunrise: January 17, 1948     Sunset: August 20, 2019
Clinton Brown Jr. "Butch" was born on January 17, 1948 to Mary Eskridge and Clinton Brown Sr. in Chicago, Illinois. His mother while he was a toddler he moved to Oakland to live with his grandmother, Mary Louise Eskridge and aunt Moochie. While in Oakland at an early age, Clinton gave his life to the Lord. After graduation, he joined the United States Marines. In 1973, "Butch" became a sharp shooter. After leaving the military Clinton moved to Las Vegas, NV and began his career as a cook at the Rivera, El Cortez, Las Vegas Club, Hacienda, and Big Mama's "Butch" loved the Lord with everything inside of him. In his early years, he was very active at The Church of Lord Jesus and Tabernacle of Faith. You would see Clinton, picking up all the children to go to church in the can or in front of the church fulfilling his deacon duties. Clinton loved sports with baseball being his favorite. He played on several baseball teams in Las Vegas. You would always see him with one of his favorite teams, The dodgers or the Raiders hats on the top of his head. While in Las Vegas, Clinton met his soulmate, Lorraine Joshua in 1979. For the next 40 years, Clinton and Lorraine built an unbeatable friendship and bond, with them finally solidifying their love in marriage in 2016. Clinton was a very settle man, you could always find him watching a sports game on T.V.  cracking jokes, nicknaming the grandkids, or cooking his infamous smothered potatoes. He was loved by many left years of memories for those who were blessed to know him. 

On August 20th, 2019, Clinton Brown Jr lost his battle with liver cancer and has gone to join his loved ones beyond the skies to be with the most high God.
]]>

item.title: Doris Adams
item.description:
Sunrise: October 12, 1948     Sunset: August 30, 2019
Doris Elizabeth Cole was born unto Gilbert and Daisy Cole, on October 12, 1948 in Chicago, IL. She was the youngest of six children. Mom and Dad and four siblings all preceded her into eternity.

Doris was educated in the Chicago Public School system, where she loved to not only learn, but to play sports and excel in them with trophies in bowling. 

Doris received Jesus Christ and was thanking him for saving her clear up to her coherent conversation in her last days in August 2019.

Doris married Levi Wilson Sr. into this union came Dazette Cole, Levi Wilson Jr., and Alonzo Wilson whom she loved and mothered with all her heart and soul. Doris married her current beloved husband Charles Adams Sr., he lovingly called her "Peanut" and into this union he brought Charles Adams Jr., Lisa Adams, and Gerod Adams.

Doris worked for the United States Postal Service in the early '70's and retired from the University Medical Center (UMC) Nevada due to health challenges.

Doris was always the life in a crowd, she never met a stranger and could hold a long conversation with anyone who could talk. She loved Western Movies, Dominoes and Bid Whist, where she considered herself a Whistologist from the many Bostons she ran on people.
