item.title: Shirley Broughton
item.description:
Sunrise: October 1, 1958     Sunset: August 11, 2019
On October 01, 1958, a 7-pound precious baby girl Shirley Ann Broughton Proctor was born to the late James and Allie May Proctor. Shirley Ann grew up in Las Vegas, Nevada where she accepted Christ at a young age. She attended Eldorado High School where she was the star of the women's basketball team. Shirley Ann became a member of the Culinary Union where she served as a cook for various Las Vegas Strip hotels for many years. She would later meet the love of her life Jack Gatlin. (who preceded her in death) Those that were close to Shirley knew she had 3 favorite hobbies. She loved to play Bingo on Saturday's with her daughters and cook and watch wrestling on Sundays with her close friend Ms. Nancy Harris.

item.title: Hattie Thompson
item.description:
Sunrise: June 22, 1951     Sunset: August 14, 2019
Ms. Hattie B Thompson was borrowed from heaven on June 22, 1951 by her parents David Thompson and Wyome Mays Thompson. Hattie carried on the legacy of the Thompson Family name as she was named after her late Grandmother, Hattie B Thompson. Hattie was born and raised in Bastrop, Louisiana. She later relocated to Los Angeles, California after the passing of her father. Hattie's mother married Howard Brown after the death of David Thompson.

Hattie accepted Christ at a young age. She had a passion for youth and began to work in the Youth Ministry Department at Rose of Sharon COGIC Los Angeles, California under the leadership of Bishop Clarence Lewis. Hattie was so excited about her love for Christ and her church life that she shared her relationship with Christ with her Mother and two older sister, Eva Mae and Rosalee. Each of them subsequently accepted Christ. 

Hattie made sure her six children went to church and developed a relationship with Christ. Each of them accepted Christ as their Lord and Savior.

In 2013, Hattie relocated to Las Vegas, Nevada. She became an active member of Ambassadors For Christ Faith Ministries under the leadership of her oldest son, Pastor Stevie R. Thompson. She became a member of the Mother's Board. Her faithfulness was reqarded with the perfect attendance award at their Annual Christmas Banquet.

On August 14, 2019 at 3:05AM she made her transition to be with Christ.
]]>

item.title: Twanique Austin
item.description:
Sunrise: October 15, 1990     Sunset: August 22, 2019
A beautiful soul was birthed on October 15, 1990 to the proud parents, Candy Smith and Terry Austin at 7:55 pm in Las Vegas, Nevada. She was the only daughter born to this union. Shortly after her birth, her mother would have to take her back to the hospital. This is when Twanique's diagnosis of Cerebral Palsy was explained. Unbeknownst to her family, "Twinkie" a nickname given to her, would show us that she may be wheelchair bound but the chair will not hold her down.

Twinkie received her first wheelchair at the young age of three. During this time, Twinkie learned to ride horses to strengthen her back as Hippo Therapy so she would be able to sit up in the chair. Twinkie attended elementary school but her middle and high school years were spent at Variety School. It was here where Twinkie learned her first word "blue", how to feed herself, how to use walkers, and how to swim. They tried to giver her an ipad because she was non-verbal. However, Twinkie threw the ipad on the floor and declared, "I can talk for myself." She obtained her diploma June 11, 2009. as a Certificate of Completion. Twinkie liked a famous quote by Frederick Douglass that reads, "If there is no struggle, there is no progress". Twinkie had a physical struggle but her progress in life was phenomenal.

Over the years, Twanique was taught by her mother that she could be anything, she could do anything, and go wherever her heart desired. These bits of wisdom from her loving mom would propel Twinkie to become the determined, self-willed, independent young lady we knew her to be. As a result of this, Twinkie decided she wanted to work. Twanique worked part time at Transition Services for seven (7) years and attended Nevada Adult Day Care. In 2012, Life Long Dreams assisted Twinkie in her endeavor to go to Hollywood. She met her favorite actor Kyle Massey from "That's So Raven and Cory's in the House". She would also meet "Mr. Belding" Dennis Haskins from "Saved by the Bell". He became intrigued with Twinkie's hair and began to play in it. Not to be outdone, Twinkie began to run her fingers through his hair. 

In her adult life, Twinkie began to attend Tabernacle of Praise Church of God in Christ. She was adamant about her praise. She took note of how her Pastor would praise God and preach and would imitate him. Twinkie was baptized by her Pastor with a special hyssop branch. Twinkie loved God's people and always had a smile on her face.  If you got close to her, she would draw you in with her powerful, strong arms and strike up a conversation with you. Twanique never wanted for anything. God was a provider and her mother made sure she was well taken care of. Twinkie had an advocate here on earth. 

Early Thursday morning, August 22, 2019 Twanique ascended into the arms of her Lord and Savior Jesus Christ and He welcomed this beautiful soul.
]]>

item.title: Mardrue Bunton
item.description:
Sunrise: December 23, 1932     Sunset: July 20, 2019
Mardrue Dennis Bunton Jr., known to family and friends as "MD", passed away on September 20, 2019, at the age of 86 years.

A native of Austin, Texas, at the age of 10 years, he moved to Los Angeles, California with his mother Annie Bunton. In his youth, Dennis participated in Boy Scouts and Eastside Boys. 

Dennis attended public schools in L.A.: 49th and Main Street, George Washington Carver high and later John H. Frances Poly Technic High School. He ran long distance on the Poly Technic High track and field team and participated in football. He was the only one in his class to earn Poly letters in both sports and participated in the famous 1959 coliseum relays. 

After graduating from Poly Technic High School, Dennis joined the United States Army and served his country during the Korean War. Dennis enjoyed his commitment to his country and community. He also completed 8 years in the Army and Air Force Reserves and finished his service with an Honorable Discharge. After coming out of the army, he worked for the U.S. Postal Service and as a security officer for the City of Los Angeles and Los Angeles County Parks and Recreation.

On September 26, 1958, Dennis met and married a wonderful woman, Mary Bowling.

In the 1960's, Dennis began his law enforcement career with the Compton Police in Compton, California. He was the third African American officer hired to the Compton Police Department and progressed through the ranks. He later became the director and developer of the Compton Neighborhood Service Center, an agency supporting the legal needs of the Watts and the Compton communities. After great success with his leadership and programs he returned to uniformed duty as a Sergeant and finished his 30 years peace officer career in the rank of Lieutenant of Watch-Commander for Compton PD. While he had an continued commitment to the family and his Police officer's duties, Dennis completed his Bachelor of Political Science at Cal State in Los Angeles. Dennis served as security at his former church Bryant Temple, AME, Los Angeles, California, under the leadership of Rev. V.L. Brenson and First Lady Qunilne Brenson (National Black Officer Association members).

After retiring to Las Vegas, Nevada in the early 90's with his wife of 53 years, Mary Bunton, a beautiful woman of the Lord. He and his family joined Holy Trinity AME Church where he served several years as the president of the Sons of Allen under the leadership of Rev. Emmanuel Wasson and First Lady Juanita Wasson.
]]>

item.title: Willie Ross
item.description:
Sunrise: April 22, 1957     Sunset: August 7, 2019
Willie Gene Ross was born in Lorraine Ohio on April 22, 1957 to Charlie Ross Sr and Willie Mae Ross. In 1959 the family relocated to Las Vegas, Nevada. Willie Gene attended Clark High School where he graduated. "Genie" as we all knew him kept himself busy. He worked for Silver State Republic (Teamster), Wittlesea Cab (Mechanic), and Gaudin Ford as a detailer. Beside his unconditional love for this Children Cory and Crystal his other love was being a mechanic. Genie kept his head in those Auto Books and he passes his legacy down to his Son Cory. Genie loved his 1972 White Thunderbird "that was his baby". Genie took care of the neighborhood as well as they took care of him. He was greatly appreciated for fixing on vehicles. He was a kind hearted man and would give you the shirt off his back No Questions asked. We all can agree the "Give him fifty feet was one of his favorite sayings. In Genie younger years he had a love for Roller Skating. His daughter Crystal was the only one in the neighborhood who knew how to roller blade because of her dad. On family nights we would sure to find him at Crystal Palace Skating Ring. Lets not forget he loved his mothers sweet potato pie and wasn't bad in the kitchen himself. 
]]>

item.title: Samuel Washington
item.description:
Sunrise: May 7, 1944     July 14, 2019
Samuel Washington was born May 7, 1944 in Jacksonville, Florida to Christine Kelly and Samuel Washington Sr. He was the 2nd oldest child of nine brothers. 

Samuel later moved to Chicago, Illinois where he grew up and attended high school, and met his devoted wife Veronica in 1972. Samuel and Veronica had two children Saron and Onica. Together they blended the family with Rickey and Lamont.

In 1978, Samuel and Veronica together with their son Saron moved to California where they had a daughter Onica in 1988. Samuel also graduated from Chaffey College and opened many different businesses. Samuel enjoyed running his own businesses, traveling, spending time with family, and he loved taking pictures and home videos. Samuel was always taking pictures, wherever he went and always had a camera in his hand. Samuel was loved by all he came in contact with and will be greatly missed.
]]>

item.title: Beatrice Murphy
item.description:
Sunrise: April 29, 1947     Sunset: August 8, 2019
Beatrice met and married Tom Allen, (proceeded her in death). To this union four children were born. Later she met and married Anderson Murphy. To this union two children were born.

Beatrice's last union in life was with Reginald Daniels and to this union a single child was born.

Beatrice worked for Brody's Advertising and Calmark Mail Services. She also worked for Borg and Warner in Bellwood, IL for many years.

Beatrice relocated to Milwaukee, WI. She united with Christian Faith Fellowship Church under the leadership of Darrell and Pamela Hines. She was self-employed, establishing and operating a child care business. 

Seeking a better climate due to her health, she related to Las Vegas, NV where she united with Mountain Top Faith Ministries, under the leadership of Pastor Clinton and Dr. Mary House.

Beatrice was a loving devoted wife, mother, grandmother, great grandmother, and great-great grandmother. She was the matriarch of the family. A tower of strength, quiet, still and resilient. Beatrice operated a Child Care business, until her health began to fail. 

Beatrice, affectionately known as "B" had a unique and distinct way of answering the telephone by saying "Hello my darling" making everyone fell extra special.

She had an unconditional love for her family. There was no end to the sacrifices that she made for family and loved ones. Beatrice was everyone's mother she met no strangers. The spirit that God blessed her with was felt by all. She was embraced by everyone who came in contact with her.

Beatrice loved attending church and praising God. She would attended Moments of Blessings House of Prayer Pastored by Bishop Tommy Collier and First Lady Collier and most recently Refreshing Waters Ministries Pastored by Pastor Farrell and Pastor Lola Hester, where she was adopted and loved by all.

On Thursday, August 8th, 2019 Beatrice made her exit from her earthly home to make her entry into her Heavenly home to be in the presence of God eternally. Beatrice had "A leak in her building; her soul had to move!" Therefore, she shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that bringeth forth her fruit in her season, and her leaf also shall not wither whatsoever she doeth shall prosper, Psalm 1:3.
]]>

item.description:

Clarence La Von Young III was born in Las Vegas, Nevada on February 10, 1988 to the parents of Clarence Young Jr. and Corla White Sr.

Von-E was baptized at an early age at Greater Evergreen Missionary Baptist Church, under the leadership of the late of the late Pastor Nathaniel Whitney.

Clarence graduated from Rancho High School in 2006. He was employed as a butcher at a local supermarket. Von-E shared a special love with his wife LaToya Mosley over 12 years.

item.title: Annie Handy
item.description:
Sunrise: April 12, 1941     Sunset: July 10, 2019
Annie Bell Handy was born on 12 April 1941, to he late West Richard & Hazel Richard in Tallulah, Louisiana. September 1943 they relocated to Las Vegas, Nevada.

Annie was the 3rd of four children. She was raised in strangers Home Baptist church to the late Reverend J.L. Simmons where she worked on the usher board as jr. usher until Stranger Home became St. James Baptist Church. She served in this capacity spiritually. God blessed St. James MBC. Annie remained loyal and very committed in faith under the leadership of the late Reverend Donell Horn Sr., the founder and pastor of New Revelation MBC. She later joined Israelite COGIC under Paster Jesse Moore; Until her passing she attended New Beginning under the leadership of Pastor Bobby Smith. 

Annie was employed by Bally's hotel for over 30 years. With the love she had for children she retired and became a crossing guard. She was loved by everyone in the neighborhood and everyone loved to come to 301 and enjoyed her being the neighborhood candy lady.

Annie went home to be with God late Wednesday night 10 July 2019 at her home.

item.title: Antwan McKenzie Brumfield
item.description:
Sunrise: July 13, 1970     Sunset: July 8, 2019
Roshawn was born July 13, 1970 to Janice Brumfield and Roosevelt Kelly (deceased).

Roshawn attended school in Las Vegas, NV. She attended EOB head Start, Red Rock & Matt Kelly Elementary; Kenny Guinn Middle School and graduated from ED. W. Clark High School in 1988. She received her Associated Degree in Business from CCSN.

Roshawn worked at various jobs; Terrible Herbst, Barbary Coast, Gold Coast, Golden Nugget and her last 21 years at Clark County School District.

Roshawn met and married Jimmy McKenzie, and from that union one daughter was born, Jameelah McKenzie.

Roshawn was baptized in 1987 at St. James Baptist Church under the leadership of late Pastor Donell Horn Sr.

God called his angel Roshawn home on July 8, 2019.

item.title: Deborah Reed
item.description:
Sunrise: May 12, 1968     Sunset: July 9, 2019
Deborah Diane Reed was born May 12, 1968 to Timothy C. Reed Sr. and Merrilyn D. Reed. Deborah attended school in the Clark County School District where she received her GED. Dee had several jobs that she loved in the food industry and construction field. Even though she didn't have any kids she had many nieces and nephews that she loved and treated as her own. Deborah was the type of person that never took anyone or anything for granted and live her life to the fullest.
]]>

item.title: Annette Wilridge
item.description:
Sunrise: August 17, 1966     Sunset: July 2, 2019
Annette Denise "Hollywood" was born to William Walker and Essie Lee Walker on August 17, 1966 in Las Vegas, NV. Annette was born with an addition, a twin sister. Annette attended Las Vegas High School. During high school she started working at Bally's Hotel & Casino and continued her employment at Bally's after graduating high school. While working she continued her education at Apollo Computer Tech alongside her mother. she worked at Bally's for 17 years. She left in 2001 to pursue other interests and dreams. But, if you knew Nette she couldn't keep still; she went back to work and worked two jobs simultaneously at Sunrise Hospital and Tinker Town. She confessed her love and soul to the Lord at an early age. She was baptized and reborn at the Church of Lord Jesus in the early 90's.

She met and married Sidney Wilridge in 1994. Where they started a beautiful family of their own. she was very passionate about her grandkids! They never did any wrong in her eyes. She loved to dance and drop it low, shop with her twin sister and bestie, watch tv's Law & Order and The Have and Have Nots and of course talking mess to whomever she could in her spare time. She loved cleaning and keeping her house clean. She ALWAYS had her nails, hair and feet done and stayed dressed down. And that's where she got the name "HOLLYWOOD" because the way she dressed herself and her children, you would've thought they lived in Hollywood.

She was such a family oriented woman who loved you even if you weren't blood family. She had such a giving heart and didn't mind giving her last. On July 2, 2019 Annette was called home to be with the Lord.
]]>

item.title: William Thomas Jr.
item.description:
Sunrise: September 18, 1949     Sunset: July 2, 2019
William Thomas Jr. was born to William Thomas and Luetta Thomas. He was the eldest of four children. 3 sisters; Darlene, Dorothy, Barbara and one brother. His family all proceeded him in death.

William Thomas, Jr. was baptized in California.

Thomas graduated from high school and he joined the Air Force. After reaching the rank of Sergeant, he left the military and moved to Las Vegas. He worked for the Economic Opportunity Board (E.O.B.) and later worked for Vegas Valley Water District.

Thomas met Tita Griffin 1974 and to this union two daughters were born; Barbara and Sharon Thomas.

Thomas moved to Newark, New Jersey to attend college for computer. He then moved to California to be close to his family. In 2017, Thomas moved back to Las Vegas.

Thomas battled liver cancer.

item.title: Terrance Chadwick, Sr.
item.description:
Sunrise: February 15, 1981     Sunset: July 2, 2019
Terrance Antwon Chadwick, Sr. was born on February 15, 1981 in Las Vegas, Nevada to Gregory Chadwick and Rosetta Norwood - Chadwick. At an early age, Terrance accepted Christ and was baptized.

Terrance attended and received his education through the Clark County School District. He attended Western High School, where he graduated in 1999. 

Terrance held numerous jobs in the hospitality industry, which was fitting for his charismatic and out-going personality. In 2015, terrance stepped out on faith and put on his entrepreneur hat and opened "Ban Boyz Mobile Detailing". Which he operated with a passion until his health began to decline.

For a few years, Terrance attended The Potter's Place Church under the leadership of Pastor Toni Collins-Barringer, whome he adored. In early 2019, Terrance re-dedicated his life to Christ and joined Grace Emmanuel Baptist church under the leadership of Pastors Willie and Jerry Wheaton. 

Terrance (TBoy) was known for being the "life of the party". His larger than life personality and huge grin was infectious! Terrance was a "ridah" for those he loved and always made it a point to let you know how he felt. Terrance was so animated and loving, that it was impossible to not laugh in his presence (especially when he hit the dance floor)!
]]>

item.title: Roy Henderson
item.description:
Sunrise: August 8, 1950     Sunset: June 24, 2019
Mr. Roy Wayne Henderson was born to Katherine Carr and Thurman Henderson in Sondheimer, Louisiana, August 8th, 1950. 

Wayne accepted Christ at an early age at New Zion Missionary Baptist Church under the leadership of Reverend E.L. Cable. He received his education from East Carroll Parish Public Schools.

Wayne moved to Las Vegas, Nevada in the early 70's. He sought and obtained employment at the Frontier Hotel and Casino. There he met Shirley Jean Mathews; and to this union they were blessed with two children. Wayne remained at the Frontier in a career he loved he retired. Even in retirement his duties continued as a loving father, husband, brother, son, uncle, grandpa, and best friend.

Wayne was a man of Faith. He all types of music, from gospel to "Downhome" blues. In his free time loved to play games from Spades, Tonk, Pitty Pat, event Go Fish. BUT his favorite was Dominoes...which leads us to the Fellas, where he could be found every Sunday. The Crew constated of his hometown Buddies. 

Wayne was one of a kind, you would never see him out without his hat, shades, gold jewelry, and that smile that would light up and room. He was always cool, clean, creased and smelling good. 

Wayne will be embraced in his new home by his Heavenly Father and loving wife Irene Harrison Henderson with whom he shared 27 wonderful years.
]]>

item.title: Roosevelt Wallace
item.description:
Sunrise: May 11, 1978     Sunset: July 4, 2019
Roosevelt Wallace was born May 11, 1978 to the late Samuel Earl McGhee and Sarah Ann Wallace in Eudora, Arkansas. He graduated from Eudora High School and moved to Las Vegas, NV in 1997.

On February 26, 1997 Roosevelt united in holy matrimony to Tamika McDonald of Las Vegas, NV; to this union in 1997, one handsome son was adopted, and three beautiful children were born. 

Roosevelt (Billy) was an outdoorsman, and thoroughly enjoyed working with his Grandfather and Grandmother in their garden and on their farm. Love-ones hold fond memories of him wearing his short pants and cowboy boots.

Roosevelt departed this life on the evening of July 4, 2019, at Sunrise Hospital and Medical Center in Las Vegas, NV.
]]>

item.title: Anden Paige
item.description:
Sunrise: June 3, 2007     Sunset: June 18, 2019
Anden Lee Shawn Paige was born June 3, 2007. He was God's Gift to Socorra Paige and Stephen Adkins. Anden was a loving and very active child. He brightened up every room with a "prank" and his contagious smile! Everyone who came in contact with him was in love. 

Anden accepted Christ at an early age. Additionally, he grew up in Compton, California by way of Lancaster. Anden had a love for rapping and putting on many shows (LOL). His favorite color was green. What's funny is that he had a blanket (fleece camouflage throw) that he would wear 'acting like Superman' on many occasions!

Anden resided in Las Vegas, NV, until God found cause to call him home to be with him on June 18, 2019. Although he will be truly missed by many near and far, his memories will live on forever.
]]>

item.title: Eloise Caldwell
item.description:
Sunrise: April 8, 1959     Sunset: June 26, 2019
Eloise Caldwell was born on April 8, 1959 in Monroe, Louisiana to Luther, Jr. & the late Mary Lee Brothers-January. She was baptized at an early age and united with Pilgrim Baptist Church in Winnsboro, Louisiana under the leadership of the late Rev. E.G. Lumpkins. She attended Winnsboro Elementary School and Winnsboro Jr. High School and graduated from Wossman High School in Monroe, LA, Class of 1977. Then she went on to Grambling State University. At Grambling, Eloise pledged to the Delta Sigma Theta sorority and became a Delta in the spring of 1979. She moved to Las Vegas in 1982, a single mother of two daughters, whom she loved with all of her heart. She worked so hard to provide the best life possible for her family and to instill in them all of the love, Faith and strength she had within her! She joined Victory Missionary Baptist Church under the leadership of the late Rev. J.E. Richarson, Sr. and in 1992, was one of the very first members of the newly organized Tabernacle of Faith, under the leadership of Bishop Corine W. Claiborne. She remained a faithful and dedicated member of Tabernacle of Faith until she was called home. Eloise has been a faithful and dedicated choir member, praise team leader, Sunday school teacher, Vacation Bible School teacher, on the finance committee, chaired over many auxiliaries in the church, licensed Evangelist, Minister, and recently promoted to Associate Pastor. Wherever help was needed in the church, she didn't hesitate to volunteer. She was employed at the Clark County Court System for the past 24 years.

She married Jeffray Caldwell on July 27, 2004. They traveled around the country, driving and exploring the United States. They cooked, prepared, and catered meals together for church activities, family reunions, and other gatherings. She taught him how to really love someone, and he loved her! They would always show up at church or other events dressed alike. She was his perfect gift from God, for 15 years.

Eloise was a beautiful, loving, and giving person. She always had a smile that would light up the whole room. She was loved by so many that will truly miss her. Her departure from this earth has left a huge void in our hearts and our lives, but we all know that the Lord does not make mistakes. She is "Gone Too Soon" for us, but not for God. We all loved her, but God loves her more. And THAT is a lot of love...
]]>

Ashley was born in Las Vegas, Nevada at UMC Hospital on April 25, 1983 to the late Bobby Eugene Armstrong & Elizabeth Williams (Las Vegas, Nevada). Ashley attended Palo Verde High School and graduated in 2001. She graduated from the medical field in 2019. Ashley accepted Christ and was baptized a G. M. S. M. R. M. Inc. Dr. S.S. item.title: Richard Johnson
item.description:
Sunrise: August 4, 1954     Sunset: June 20, 2019
Richard Johnson was born to Freddie Hedgeman and Wallard Blackward on August 4, 1954 in Arkansas City, AR. In 1976 he traveled to Las Vegas and pursued a career in roofing at Chief's Roofing Co. He continued his career until he became disabled and retired. Richard enjoyed fishing and sitting at home watching westerns and sports. He also enjoyed cooking, listening to blues music, playing dominoes and spades. Richard also dibbled and dabbled on working on vehicles and boats. He really loved singing with the male choir. As far as personality, Richard was very strong and opinionated and did not mind saying what was on his mind. Anyone who knew him should know this.

He survived open heart surgery for 20 years, he fought and struggled with kidney problems and dialysis. He fought a good fight.

item.title: Angelo Sims
item.description:
Sunrise: March 19, 1992     Sunset: June 28, 2019
Angelo Ray Sims was born on March 19, 1993 to the Union of Matilda Sims and Kevin Turner in Chicago, IL.

Angelo completed the 12th grade at Valley High School in Las Vegas, NV. His special interest were serving others and praising God. 

Angelo began his journey with Jesus at Mt. Pilgrim Baptist Church in Milwaukee, WI. He moved to Las Vegas in 2010 where he continued to praise God at New Paradise Missionary Baptist Church.

Angelo enjoyed going to Church, spending time with his family, watching cartoons and listening to his favorite musical artist such as Charlie Wilson and Lee Williams. Angelo was one of the most kindest, whole hearted people you could ever meet. He will be deeply missed by his family, friends and all who knew him.
]]>

item.title: Stanley Wilson
item.description:
Sunrise: July 2, 1946     June 21, 2019
Stanley Wilson was born in Garland, Arkansas to Ben and Mattie Wilson. He was the 3 child of 5. Stanley went on to be with the Lord on Jun 21st, 2019, at the age of 72. He was known to family and friends as "Stanley Blood".

Stanley was educated in the Clark County School District and graduated from Rancho High School. Later in life he went on to college and earned an Associate's Degree in Arts and Letter.

Stanley mastered his careers in life. He was a Las Vegas pit boss for many years and a supervisor over Environmental Services at University Medical Center.

Stanley was a meticulous man. He was always known as the sharpest dressed hands down; you would have never seen him in a pair of tennis shoes. He would describe himself as, "Boy, I'm clean as the board of health." His assembly of suites and collections of colognes was Spectacular.

Stanley and Sharon met each other at University Medical Center during the fall of 1996. There was an instant attraction between them due to their mutual love of fashion and dedication to hard work. Shortly after their courtship Stanley boldly told Sharon that she would be his wife! They solidified their love on February 14th of 1997. They lived in holy matrimony for a total of 22 years, until God called Stanley home.
]]>

item.title: Joshua Coleman
item.description:
Sunrise: February 8, 1986     Sunset: June 8, 2019
On June 8th, 2019, Joshua D'rell Coleman died peacefully in the comfort of his own room. He was only 33 years young. He was born to Kassia A. Ephraim and Columbus E. Coleman on February 8, 1986. He was raised in Las Vegas, Nevada where he attended high school at Rancho then finished at Mojave.

Josh enjoyed rap and soft worship music, hamboning, cooking, and loved going to a quiet worshipping church. He was a bit shy and pretty much a loner. Although he suffered with bipolar condition, he was generally easy-going, thoughtful, friendly and protective of his family. The love that he had for his family was unsurpassed.

During the last weeks of his life, D'rell expressed an intense longing for his siblings and cousins.
]]>

item.title: Aaliyah Cameron
item.description:
Sunrise: April 30, 2016     Sunset: May 25, 2019
You were a precious gift, our joy, our dreams.
You were a sparkle through the darkness.
Our hope for a brighter tomorrow. 
You warmed our hearts, gave us light to our minds, and beauty to our spirits. 
We gave you our love, wrapped you in our care. 
Caressed you with our smiles.
Now you are gone.
We grieve.
We miss you so much.
The loving memories of you will keep you forever close to us in our hearts, our thoughts, our souls.
]]>

item.title: Annie Monroe
item.description:
Sunrise: November 21, 1956     Sunset: June 12, 2019
Ms. Annie Ruth Monroe was born in Jackson, Mississippi on November 21, 1956 to Mr. John D. and Mrs. Annie Mae Monroe. She was the second born of five siblings. She was the oldest daughter, which lead her to become like a second mother in her family. she was definitely a loving caregiver. She loved her family and it showed.

Ms. Annie Ruth grew up here in Las Vegas and graduated from Western High School. She worked as a food server in the casinos for many years. She later married Ernest Hayes. She worked hard all her life unselfishly for family and those around her. She cooked large meals for every holiday, shopped and cleaned their home from top to bottom. She was an angel. Most recently, she lovingly cared for her mother who suffers from dementia. She was an amazing woman but most importantly she had a personal relationship with our Lord and Saviour; Jesus Christ. Her last words expressed the love that she had for the Lord and her family. She will be greatly missed by all of us who loved her.
]]>

item.title: Nathaniel Troutman
item.description:
Sunrise: May 11, 1949     Sunset: June 9, 2019
Was born May 11, 1949 to the late Porter and Julia Troutman in Alexandria, Louisiana. Nathaniel moved to Las Vegas, Nevada December 5, 1961 at the age of 12 where he resided until his death.

Nathaniel went to Rancho High School until he enlisted in the military May 17, 1966 and served in the Vietnam War and returned home with an honorable discharged August 1968.

Nathaniel worked many jobs. One which he loved the most and that was with the Las Vegas Housing authority as (The Mail man).

On February 1, 1999 he married his long-term love of his life, Anita (Burks) Troutman.
]]>

item.title: Matthew Howard
item.description:
Sunrise: April 6, 1970              Sunset: June 7, 2019
Matthew Howard aka Punkin, P Funk was born on April 6, 1970 to Helen Howard Washington and John Levi. Matthew was educated in Las Vegas area attending Rose Warren Elementary, Garside Jr. High and graduated from Bonanza High School.

Matthew was truly a sports lover, he enjoyed playing baseball and boxing was his favorite sport, and he was known as the "One Hitter Quitter." Matthew lived life to the fullest until he surrendered his life over to the Lord, that's when his true mission began. When he fell in love with the Lord Jesus Christ, he began to be a God chaser. Matthew loved the Lord with his whole heart and told all that came into his presence about the goodness of the Lord. He was very gifted using his talents wisely. He was a self-promoter starting with his children New Day, that performed before thousands and traveled throughout our city singing at churches, schools, talent shows, and opening up different events. He exemplified one that lived a regenerated life as he pursued souls for the Kingdom of god. He was truly a soul winner. His soul winning started in his home first teaching the word of God and literally having full service with his wife, children, nieces, and nephews. Matthew was not a perfect man but he served a perfecting God in which he trusted to known God would work out all things for his good if he continued to trust him. 

For those who truly knew him, he had a word he used constantly; perspective. We may not follow everything according to his perspective, but his legacy he lived and leaves behind if all would view his perspective; which was to believe in Jesus Christ and except Christ into your life, as your Lord and Savior, and know you will be saved from you sins, we will all see him again. Matthew fought a good fight and he finished his course. Today we declare Matthew's mission accomplished.
]]>

item.title: Journei Jackson
item.description:
Sunrise: November 20, 2018                 Sunset: June 2, 2019
Journei Emoni Jackson was born November 20, 2018 to her parents Brianna Rayford and Joe Lee Jackson III in Las Vegas, Nevada. She departed this life on June 2, 2019 in her hometown. She leaves behind two great grand-mother, two grandmother's, one granddad and a host of aunts, uncles and cousins.
]]>

item.title: Khaliyah Brown
item.description:
Sunrise: June 3, 2003                     Sunset: May 25, 2019
God gave Datrise Brown a beautiful baby girl on June 3, 2003. God seen this baby suffer from birth and sent for her to be with him on May 25, 2019. Khaliyah started school at John F. Miller as a toddler just 3 years old.

Most people would say that Khaliyah was special and not because she was born with (TSC) which lead her to her death but because she would always smile a lot and her favorite was applesauce and oatmeal. Although she had a disability she was full of love. Khaliyah didn't like her wheelchair and getting her hair done, but she loved taking baths which made her so relaxed.

Khaliyah fought a good fight and despite her disability she left us in good spirits. 
]]>

item.title: Eileen Caldwell
item.description:
Sunrise: October 21, 1929     Sunset: May 21, 2019
On Tuesday, May 21, 2019 our Matriach, our core, and our heart was called home to be with the Lord. Her name is Eileen Viola (Barnes) Caldwell.

Eileen was born to the union of Valmore and Viola (Johns) Barnes in October 21, 1929 in Brooklyn, NY. Eileen was one of five children, Phyllis (Barnes) Foster, Rudolph Barnes, Valmore Jr Barnes, Elzina (Lillie) Barnes.

Eileen was very ambitious as a child. As a child her favorite color was red, which stuck with her throughout her youth. She was then nicknamed "Red". She began her early education at PS 429 in Brooklyn, NY. She graduated from Jones High School also in Brooklyn.

After High School, Eileen met Hubert Caldwell. The two began courting and then become one through their union of marriage. She was a stay at home wife. Shortly after Hubert & Eileen got settled in as newlyweds the two gave birth to their eldest son Michael Derrick Caldwell.

Shortly after Michael was born, Eileen returned to the workforce working at a candy manufacturer warehouse in Brooklyn. After a short time Eileen moved on to bigger and better things when she was hired to work for the United States Post Office. Eileen then had her younger son Mark Caldwell. Eileen loved working at the post office as a mail clerk. Unfortunately, Herbert and Eileen split and Hubert moved to California.

A short time after, her oldest son Michael enlisted in the United States Air Force. Michael also moved to California for his service. However, that stay lasted a span of 5-6 years.

eileen took care of herself and her sons the best way she knew how. Making sure they were good spiritually, physically, and mentally. That's how amazing she was.

Eileen retired and enjoyed herself by playing the number, watching television and taking many trips to Las Vegas and California. She loved watching TV shows such as The Steve Harvey Show, Family Feud, & Wendy Williams. Eileen also loved to cook. Oxtails were her favorite.

Eileen was a no holds barred type person. She gave it to you straight whether you liked it or not! She was a women of truth, respect, and wisdom, and she will truly be missed!
]]>

item.title: Arkedra Taylor
item.description:
Sunrise: June 16, 1975     Sunset: May 24, 2019
Arkedra Shamona Taylor was born on June 16, 1975. In Shreveport, Louisiana to the late Katherine Kay and natural father Glenn Taylor Sr. Arkedra resided in Las Vegas, Nevada in the late 80's and was raised by Katherine Kay and George Patterson. Kikaboo worked for many call centers including Quality Home Foods. She had a passion for cooking and one day plan to open Kay's Kitchen. She also enjoyed spending time with loved ones and hosting events. Kikaboo always had a bright smile and was always down for food and laughs. Kikaboo was the oldest of 5 and was always the protector. Kikaboo will be dearly missed and loved.
]]>

item.title: Reggie Christensen
item.description:
Sunrise: May 27, 1976     Sunset: January 14, 2019
Reggie Christensen was born on May 27th, 1976 in Las Vegas, Nevada to Don and Dorothy Christensen. Reggie was the second born child of Don and Dorothy Christensen union. On January 14, 2019 Reggie peacefully answered his heavenly call home.

Reggie a Native of Las Vegas attended Western High School. Reggie worked at Walker Furniture for 8 years. In his leisure time Reggie loved working on cars and enjoying time participating with his car club OneLuv. Reggie was known for his lavish taste in cars. He loved taking a car from nothing and making it something. Reggie never rode alone, he always had one of his children by his side.

In the year of 1997 Reggie met Cherise Clary also of Las Vegas, Nevada. The two were joined together in Holy Matrimony in the year 2000. Reggie and Cherise shared 22 years of marriage. In their marriage they were blessed with 5 loving children. Reggie was a father like no other, his family was his pride and joy! He enjoyed going to the children's games and cheering them on. Reggie was also blessed with 5 grandchildren.

Reggie also loved spending time with family, playing dominos, spades or just engaging in conversation. Reggie always greeting you with a smile, he was always happy to see family! He was truly a soul that will be dearly missed.
]]>

item.title: Hester Williams
item.description:
Sunrise: September 2, 1928     Sunset: December 12, 2018
Hester was born to the proud parents of Johnnie and Frances Evans on September the 2nd 1928. Hester is the second child of fourteen children. She later married Elder Sidney Williams in Little Rock, Arkansas. In this union six children were born; three daughters and three sons. 

Hester was always very organized, loved to give people orders to cook, especially her favorite niece Roselyn (black girl). Hester selected her friends very carefully and was never a stranger to anyone. 

Hester lived in Richmond California, after living in Richmond California she moved to Los Banos California and then to Las Vegas, Nevada where God brought her home. Hester was a Top chef at Foster's Restaurant in Oakland, California for fifty years, during which she brought her brother in law Billy Bond and her two brothers David Evans and Virgil Evans to Foster's Restaurant where they all worked together. Hester's home was open to anyone who visited her, especially the Safeway warehouse workers; her brother and son in law and their friends. She never turned anyone away that was hungry, and she got it from her Momma Maya.

She loved her music Aretha Franklin, Bobby Blue Band and Tyrone Davis, (Turn back the hands of time).

Hester we are really going to miss you...
]]>

item.title: Robert Charles Richardson
item.description:
Sunrise: May 15, 1957     Sunset: May 11, 2019
Robert Charles Richardson was born on May 15th, 1956 to Lafayette Richardson and Marie Louise Richardson of Las Vegas, Nevada. He accepted Christ and was a member of Tabernacle of Faith, pastor by Corine Claiborne.

He passed away on May 11th, 2019 at 1:27 a.m. at Sunrise Hospital with his niece by his side(Raven Symone).

He attended Clark High School. He was a member of the culinary union for more than 20 years. He worked at several of the major hotels on the Las Vegas Strip and in Tonopah, Nevada. He was a professional and licensed chef. Cooking was his passion. He loved music and he loved to dance. He was kind, soft-hearted, and a hard worker.

Robert loved his family and leaves us with lots of fun memories. You will truly be missed.
]]>

item.title: Luke Jones, Sr.
item.description:
Sunrise: June 4. 1939     Sunset: March 26, 2018
Luke Jones, Sr. was second child born to Nathaniel and Laura Jones on June 4, 1939 in Tunica, Mississippi. 

Luke confessed Christ at an early age and was baptized at Hopewell Baptist Church in Mississippi.

Luke attended public schools in Tunica and graduated from Tunica High School. He decided to enter the trucking profession as a truck driver. He thoroughly enjoyed being on the road and traveled to most of the states.

He met and married Mary Louise Williams. Five children were born to this union. Seeking a better life, he moved his family to Memphis and later to Chicago. In the mid 1980's. Luke moved to Los Angeles. He met and married Amanda Boykins. A loving, blended family was formed as he raised Amanda's children as his own.

The family moved to Las Vegas. Luke worked as a casino porter and detailed cars. He was the handyman of handymen, fixing anything that was put in front of him. But the road called, and he returned to trucking. He retired from this profession in 1995.

Luke loved his family and friends and enjoyed the times they spent together. His passion was fishing and hunting. If someone would ask about going to one of these activities, a sparkle would appear in his eyes, he would have a huge smile and of course the answer was a resounding YES! He also enjoyed cooking, shooting pool and dancing. He loved to have a good time.
]]>

item.title: Loretta Hines
item.description:
Sunrise: July 9, 1940     Sunset: December 20, 2018
Loretta D. Hines was born July 9, 1940 in Little Rock, Arkansas, and was raised by Jeanette Watson and Bubba Verbal Hines. She moved to Las Vegas in 1958 and started her own family. Loretta Hines was a loving mother of seven children and eleven grandchildren. She will be joining two of her sons, and one daughter.

Loretta D. Hines was a dedicated member of Jew Jerusalem church for 60 years. She was always known as being the Candy Lady.
]]>

item.title: Andru Rollins
item.description:
Sunrise: October 15, 1998     Sunset: November 27, 2018
Andru Jerome Rollins was born October 15, 1998 in San Bernardino, CA to Lawrence Maurice Brown, Sr. and Vernette La'trice Rollins. Andru was the third child of eight children. He accepted Christ at an early age. Andru attended Hesperia High School in Hesperia, CA where he was a dominating student in wrestling, although football was his sport.

Andru loved music, "old School". One of his favorite songs was "My Last 2 Dollars" by Johnnie Taylor.

Andru was very loving, caring, humble and his smile was so beautiful. When he would walk in the room, the whole room would brighten up. He was the finest man walking.
]]>

item.title: Nicole Wofford
item.description:
Sunrise: June 12, 1971     Sunset: December 11, 2018
Nicole Ursula Wofford was born on June 12, 1971 in Detroit, Michigan to Denise Wofford (Blackwell) and Michael Wofford. Nicole was the second born of three children. She attended Seneca High School in Gaithersburg, Maryland and Mulan Medical School, and later became a Nationally Certified Medical Assistant.

She confessed Christ at an early age life and was baptized at New Bethel Baptist Church in Spotsylvania County, VA where she developed a passion for music and sang in many choirs. Later she became a model and begin traveling all over the country. Within her modelling career days she traveled to Austria, Japan, Germany, Hawaii, Thailand, and France just to name a few. 

In 1993, while traveling through the states she stopped in Las Vegas, where she met the love of her life, Lonnie Charles Sharpe III, on a blind date. LC was her lifelong companion for 26 years and out of their love for one another was birthed 2 children.

Through the years Nicole loved helping people, cooking good food, and traveling. She extended her home to anyone who needed a helping hand. Nicole had a compassionate and considerate heart, she was definitely one of a kind. Through her children she fell in love with the teams that they played on. She supported them with all her heart, never miss a game, and there was nothing too much for her to do in support of their teams. 

After many years of illness on Tuesday, December 11, 2018 God took Nicole into his loving arms. A special thank you to the Spring Valley Grizzlies family for being such a tremendous help to our family.
]]>

item.title: Bettie Jean Davis
item.description:
Sunrise: July 6, 1941     Sunset: March 27, 2018
Bettie Jean Davis was born July 6, 1941 to Mattie Haynes of Fort Worth, TX.

Bettie married Jessie Gray and relocated to Las Vegas, Nevada on the 1960's. 

She worked as a Candy Striper at Southern Memorial Hospital, now known as UMC. She also worked for several hotels in the Las Vegas area as a guest room attendant.

Bettie was a member of Community Baptist. She fellow shipped with different churches such as New Light Baptist Church and Pilgrim Rest. 
]]>

item.title: Jacqueline Michelle Hammond
item.description:
Sunrise: July 31, 1964     Sunset: September 28, 2018
Jacqueline Michelle Hammond was born in Farmington, New Mexico on July 31, 1964 to surviving mother Betty Henderson and late father L.D. Henderson Sr. She attended school at Eldorado High School in Las Vegas, Nevada. Jackie was a fun and kind-hearted person with a survivor's spirit. She loved animals and had a passion for helping others.
]]>

item.title: Samuel Lee Kline
item.description:
Sunrise: January 27, 1935     Sunset: January 16, 2019
Samuel Lee Kline was born January 27, 1935 to Enoch Kline and Marie Richards Kline. He grew up in Thomastown, Mound Projects in the township of Tallulah, Louisiana. 

Samuel met Evelyn James in Tallulah, Louisiana and on February 6, 1958 they were married. Together they moved to Las Vegas, Nevada on September 29, 1958. Samuel worked as a School Police Officer for the Clark County School District, and he also worked at the Dunes Hotel for many years.

Samuel and Evelyn had 10 children together, 6 boys, and 4 girls.
]]>

item.title: Ja'Twion D. Farmer
item.description:
Sunrise: May 25, 1999     Sunset: February 27, 2019
Ja'Twion Farmer was born May 25, 1999 at Lake Mead Hospital in North Las Vegas, Nevada to Janice Farmer and Antwion Perry.

Ja'Twion affectionately known as "Pookie" was raised by his mother Janice Farmer and (Step-father) Joseph Leu. Ja'Twion attended school within the Clark County School District and he graduated from Sunrise Mountain High School, where he played football and later proceeded semi-pro (Vegas Black). Pookie loved playing football. Being around family, friends, and loved eating his Momma's food.

item.title: Mitchell Humphries
item.description:
Sunrise: June 6, 1986               Sunset: May 7, 2019
Mitchell James known to his family and friends as "MJ" was born June 6, 1986 to parents Paula Ann Crisler and David Wayne Humphries in Ft. Worth, Texas. He was the third of their four children. The family made their new home in Las Vegas, Nevada shortly after their fourth child.

MJ grew up going to church with his dad and his grandparents who had a strong foundation in Christ. Over the past few years MJ attended church services with his older sister where he recently gave his life to Christ and was blessed with the gift to make everyone laugh and smile, and capacity to love everybody. 

MJ was ambitious and graduated from Sierra Vista High School in 2004.

MJ played a very active role in the lives of his nieces Naryah and Nyema. Including walking them to and from school during their elementary years. This created a great and unbreakable bond between them. 

MJ was a devoted son, brother, uncle, cousin, and friend to us all. 

He enjoyed spending quality time with his family and friends especially Deontae wherever there was one there was the other. He was a force to be reckoned with on his favorite PS4 games, family comedian, and all-around life of every party. MJ expressed his love through his ear to ear smile, he loved to entertain and live life to the fullest. he was even making the nurses smile during his recent stay in Summerlin hospital. Even though he was ill and weak his spirit was still as big as the sun. 

MJ made the transition from Earth to the arms of his Heavenly Father May 7th, 2019. 

MJ you will forever be missed in the physical but forever live on in our hearts and our memories!
]]>

item.title: Juanita Johnson
item.description:
Sunrise: April 3, 1933               Sunset: May 8, 2019
Juanita Williams was born April 3, 1933 in Montgomery, Alabama to Sam and Rosa Williams. She was the oldest of her three siblings; two brothers Eligha Williams and Harry James Williams, also her beloved cousin Willie Lee Long, who was considered as a brother. Juanita completed high school in Alabama. After the death of her mother, she went to live with her aunt Sally Harris. Juanita moved to San Francisco, California at the age of eighteen. There she met and married Willie Smith.

Junaita began her work life as a waitress and later a home health aide. She remarried in 1976 to William H Johnson, and resided in Los Angeles. Juanita worked for Rockedyne, a company that built rocket engines. She became a certified forklift operator. After her and her husband retired, they moved to Las Vegas, Nevada in 1987 and became members of Second Baptist Church.

Juanita is known for her kindness to others, loved to talk about everything, loved eating (lol) and she was also an excellent cook. She always had a big smile when her immediate family was around her. She loved it! Family was important to her so when family would come in town, she would be so "happy" and she loved her friends also. Juanita loved listening to blues (her favorite) and for those who don't know KENO was her game.
]]>

item.title: Sandra Fielder
item.description:
Sunrise: November 1, 1958                Sunset: May 7, 2019
On the morning of May 7, 2019 at 7:42 am, the angel of silence came and with chilly fingers sealed the lips of a wife, mother, grandmother, sister, aunt, and friend, Sister Sandra Elaine McCormick-Fielder. Her soul winged its flight from the world of sin, sorrow, and pain to a place of eternal rest.

Sandra, one of four children born to the union of Willie and Lorine McCormick in Haldeberg, MS. Sandra at an early age, accepted Jesus Christ as her Lord and Savior. 

In 1964 Sandra's parents relocated to Las Vegas, NV where she attended Matt Kelly Elementary, Cashman Junior High and graduated from Clark High School in 1975. In 1976, Sandra attended Jackson State University in Jackson, MS.

Sandra later returned to Las Vegas, NV where she held employment at several places such as Caesar's Palace, Nevada Test Site, Sam's Town Hotel and Casino, and the Golden Nugget Hotel and Casino to name a few.

Sandra married her first husband Herbert Jones and to that union Lamica Nacole Jones was born. Sandra would later remarry to George Fielder and to that union Jaquin Larine Fielder was born. 

Sandra was known for her angelic spirit, BIG smile and loving heart. Sandra's children and grandchildren relied on her willingness to always be there no matter the time or the reason. Sandra was very family oriented, loving, and a REAL mother, grandmother, sister, sister-in-law, aunt, cousin, granddaughter and friend. 
]]>

item.title: Manson Smith Jr.
item.description:
Sunrise: April 24, 1945             Sunset: May 6, 2019
Manson Smith Jr. departed this life on May 6, 2019. Manson Smith Jr. was born in Roxton, Texas on April 24, 1945, and was the fifth child of the late Manson Smith, Sr. and the late Florence M. Lee-Smith. He was the youngest child by his father and mother. Manson was a very energetic person with a contagious personality. He loved people and was very kind and generous.

Manson was brought up in the Martin Chapel C M E Methodist Church in Roxton, Texas where he attended Sunday School and Church services. He also attended G. Smith High School.

Manson moved to Midland, Texas in 1962 to live with his oldest sister Dorothy Smith. While living there he always kept a job. He was a very independent person. He met Portia Graves in 1965 and got married in the same year and later moved to Las Vegas, Nevada. Manson worked at Flamingo Hilton his whole entire career and even received Employee of the Month in 1972. He retired from the Flamingo in 2008.

Manson loved his family. He had a very special bond with his sons and grandchildren. He enjoyed playing dominoes and spending times with his friends.
]]>

item.title: Hollis Brown
item.description:
Sunrise: March 5, 1948              Sunset: April 29, 2019
Hollis Brown was the third of sixteen siblings born to the late Mr. Ray and Georgia Peters Brown on March 5, 1948, in Columbia, Mississippi.

Hollis attended Marion Central High School where he was an outstanding basketball player on the high school varsity team. He was a die-hard fan of the Los Angeles Lakers. In 1968, he received his high school diploma. After graduation, he moved to Las Vegas, Nevada. 

In 1974, while in Las Vegas, Hollis was employed with United Airlines for forty years. During the tenure of this job, he was transferred to Chicago, Illinois and California, finally back to Las Vegas. He retired from the job in 2014.

After moving to Las Vegas, Hollis joined The Advent United Methodist Church, where he remained a faithful and dedicated member until his earthly departure. 

Hollis loved the Lord, his family, and everyone he encountered. Hollis was a man of a few words, but gave plenty of love. He loved singing and playing his guitar. His favorite song was "I like the way Jesus work."


]]>

item.title: Dorthy Richardson
item.description:
Sunrise: June 26, 1954               Sunset: April 23, 2019
Dorothy Jean Richardson was born June 26, 1954 to Addie Patterson and Jessie Brent in Chicago, IL. Both preceeding her in death. 

Dorothy attended Valley High School Class of 1972. After completing High School she went right into the work force working in several of the major hotels throughout the Las Vegas Strip and Downtown. She was a very dedicated hard worker, strating out at the Las Vegas Hilton laundry room. She also went to work in Housekeeping for 22 years at the Golden Nugget as well as a Slot Attendant at the Buffalo Bills in Primm Nevada. 

Dorothy received Christ at a very early age where she was baptised and very active at New Bethel Baptist Church. As an adult she moved her membership over to St. James Baptist Church under the Pastoral Leadership of Reverend Dornell Horn Sr. After joining St. James she went on to join the Usher Board, singing in the Choir and she put on a few Gospel Plays/Events, as well as help feed the hungry at the church pantry. 

Dorothy really loved her family and always loved hosting family and friends, she enjoyed decorating her home then cooking up some good food and would play host to her family, friends, and even invite her neighbors over to join in on the festivities. She was very passionate about music it didn't matter if it was Gospel/R&B/Blues she loved it all. She also had some dancing feet, she would cut up a dance floor at any and every party, and don't get her on a spades table or a domino table, she not getting up to quick! She really enjoyed her life to it's fullest. She had love for traveling and enjoyed attending all her family reunions.
]]>

item.title: Jordyn Williams-Tyree
item.description:
Sunrise: February 10, 2016              Sunset: April 22, 2019
Jordyn Marie Williams-Tyree was born February 10, 2016 in Toledo, Ohio. She was a beautiful, loving, and spirit filled angle of the Lord! She was child that was beyond her years. 

This three-year old loved music and enjoyed playing with her sister, JaNiyah and cousin, Amarah. Always eager and excited to learn demonstrating that excitement by learning how to ride her bike and tying her shoes. Jordyn loved playing with her Barbie dolls and her red monkey.

Jordyn loved her Pastor & First Lady and the entire TOP Family. She was always excited to attend church, especially riding on the church van. She participated in Sunday School and Raising Kingdom Kidz Children Church. she loved to recite her speeches during the Easter and Christmas programs and smart enough to learn her speech within two days. Her favorite song was "Praise is What I Do."

She was the "Hallelujah" praise warrior. While at home she would be found marching around the house praising God and saying, "Hallelujah!" with a smile on her face even though she was in pain. Her radiant smile and sweet spirit touched lives everywhere she went.

She was the sunshine and the ray of light for her great-grandmother and often expressed her love by saying, "I Love you Nana," or I'm your big girl." She was truly the joy of her Nana's life and the entire family. Jordyn was truly our little Angel sent to us by God.
]]>

item.title: Roxie Newton
item.description:
Sunrise: March 20, 1946               Sunset: April 15, 2019
Roxie M Foster Newton was born March 20, 1946, to Dolores Addison Newman and Thomas Foster in Tallulah, Louisiana. The family moved to Las Vegas, Nevada in 1947 during the great migration to the west to seek new opportunities. Roxie, lovingly called "Sugar Lump," by her family and friends, grew up in the Historic Westside during the peak of community growth and economic development in the urban village setting. She attending the historic Westside Elementary School as well as Madison Elementary in the community. Roxie was a proud graduate of Rancho High School in 1965, where she was active in the popular Pep Club and other school programs. She also was a contestant in the Miss Bronze Nevada Contest held at the Moulin Rouge in the 60's along with 16 other beautiful local young ladies in the community. 

Roxie married Murry Newton of Shreveport Louisiana in 1965, and to this union they were blessed with four children: Derrick, Nannette, Lance, and Murray, born in Las Vegas, Nevada. In 1963, Roxie joined Second Baptist Church, where she became a devoted Christian for the remainder of her life. She was a faithful member of the Choir and loyal member of the Prayer Band until her passing. Roxie served tirelessly as a teacher of the Sunday School Ministry Class #7 as well as the Vacation Bible School.

Roxie's desire to work with at risk students manifested in a career with the Clark County School District for many years. There, at the helm of groups such as the Soul Club of Eldorado High School consisted of African American students who were dedicated to positive changes at the school as well as in their communities. 

Roxie later attended and graduated from Beauty College in Las Vegas. She was a professional nail technician at Dee Dee's Original Beauty Salon, in the Nucleus Shopping Center. This was a renowned African American owned family business for more than thirty years. Roxie was proud to serve there alongside her mother, Dolores Newman and daughter, Nannette Campbell.

Roxie was an active woman who enjoyed playing softball for the Foxy's Ladies, and avid averaging in the high 200's. She also enjoyed traveling and hosting parties for friends. She was a member of the Cosmetiques of Las Vegas. She belonged to "What Are Friends For Organization" who worked with the Elks, VFW and the American Legion to assist those in need in the community: Roxie served as President of this organization until her illness. 

Roxie was an amazing mother, cook, and designer. She was a talented artist: she passed this gift to her eldest son, Derrick. Roxie enthusiastically attended her children's football, basketball, track meets and beauty pageants.
]]>

item.title: Sandra Thomas
item.description:
Sunrise: February 9, 1952                Sunset: April 15, 2019
Sandra Marie Harvey-Thomas, a devoted and loving Christian, wife, mother, grandmother, sister, aunt, and friend, transitioned from earth to glory peacefully at home surrounded by her family on Monday, April 15th, 2019 in North Las Vegas, Nevada at the age of 67.

Sandra was born on February 9, 1952 in Las Vegas, Nevada to Alfred Thomas and Floydia Harvey, in Las Vegas, NV. Both parents proceeded her in death in her young age. Sandra accepted and was baptized at an early age, her early and faithful devotion to Christ, guided her in and throughout all of her life. Sandra was a beautiful person, who always enjoyed spending time with her family, she was very caring, loving, kind, giving, supportive and just a selfless soul, who always greeted everyone in love, therefore touching and leaving a beautiful impact on many lives. She was modestly content in the most eloquent way, and content with the simple things of life, even though she was worthy of the best and royalty. Her selfless spirit never looked for recognition of praise, and never gave personal her opinion, even when asked - She always gave you the word of God nothing more and nothing less. And whatever God and the said...it was So.

Sandra enjoyed attending school and playing sports at Westside and Madison elementary, Roy Martin Middle School and later graduated from Clark high School in 1971. Upon graduation she attended a vocational school, where she earned a certificate in Office Administration. Sandra worked for the Mental Health Institution with the State of Nevada for over ten years. Where thereafter, she made the choice to pause from the employment world to nurture and care for her family full-time for ten years. After the ten years were up, God lead her back into the work field with CCSD to continue her purpose of working with children, mainly special needs, and behavioral challenged children. While working in the School district, she would walk the hallways and fields every day and every break praying, she would even anoint and lay hands on the children, praying and casting bad spirits and behavior from the kids and she did this all in love and along the way She gain much love and respect, as as fostering many wonderful friendships and beautiful bonds. Sandra gave willingly and unselfishly and in return was loved and respected to the utmost by all who knew her. She retired for CCSD after serving her purpose for 25 years. 

Some of Sandra's greatest joys in life were first and foremost faithfully serving God, praying, teaching and ministering the word of God, her family, cooking, arts and crafts, and drinking "Pepsi". Back in the day, her home was always open to the neighborhood children, as she was known as the neighborhood candy lady, and the hot tamale lady. Her love for her family and people were magnified beyond life. Sandra best and most admiring qualities she was a faithful, praying woman of God, always ready and willing to minister and pray for anyone and everyone. She was a beautiful, nurturing mother, grandmother, sister, and friend. She was an amazing cook, loving to cook for her family for every occasion, especially the holidays, where she would stay up all night preparing the holiday feast - as she loved her family and the holidays, she'd cater for parties and even small restaurants. 

She will be best remember by her calm demeanor, her patients, her ever-lasting love and kindness, felt by everyone who came into her presence. She never allowed anyone else's high strung or stressful energy or emotions affect her calmness or peace.

While you were here on earth you were already an angel that beheld peace - So we won't say Rest in Peace, but yet Enjoy your new home and family in Heaven. We greatly love you and will miss you until we take our last breath. 
]]>

Born Monday, February 21st, 1949 in Rochester, Pennsylvania, Jeanne was the 2nd oldest daughter of the late Alice Jo and James Fisher Sr. She was retired from Westinghouse Electric after 20 years. Jeanne was a deeply spiritual person, and she enjoyed watching the "Pittsburgh Steelers", spending time with her family, cards and dominoes. Everyone called Jeanne to "Get the party started." In 1968, Jeanne met and married the late Donald Fleming Sr. They had a love like no other and they cherished every moment. In 1968 she relocated her family to Las Vegas, NV where she remained until her departure.

item.title: Leonard Wesley
item.description:
Sunrise: December 27, 1957               Sunset: March 19, 2019
Leonard L Wesley graced the world with his presence on December 27, 1957 to the late union of Elizabeth Brown and Lawrence Wesley whom both preceded him in death.

Leonard Wesley was born in Los Angeles, California in summer of 1964 the family picked up and moved to Las Vegas, Nevada. Leonard was very motivated with energy and strength that carried him through Life's ups and downs laughter and pain the family of Bobby & Faye James took Leonard in after the passing of his mom and loved him unconditionally.

Leonard graduated with the "Western High School class of 1977".

Later in life Leonard pursued his career as a bartender with the Sands Hotel & Casino he gave his time and patience by talking and helping others, it became a challenge in any situation hoping for better results in the end he moved on to work at Republic Silver State Disposal employed (Roll of the truck driver) for many years. He had a few other side jobs as a truck driver. 

As the years went by Leonard fell very ill and along that path he met Elder Kevin Ray and during that time Leonard confessed to the Lord and Savior and was Baptized with the water and the blood of Jesus Christ. 

On March 19, 2019 Leonard silently and peacefully went to be with the Lord.

Following his high school graduation, he enlisted in the United States Marine Corp. and was assigned to the Special Forces Recon Squadron. In addition, he served a tour of duty in Vietnam.

Donnie was a man of many skills and talents. He was an accomplished pilot and professional tour bus driver. His hobbies included cooking, barbecuing, travelling and listening to jazz and rhythm and blues. Donnie enjoyed family gatherings and was always the life of the party.

He also attended Kit Carson Elementary School., 100 Academy of Excellence West Preparatory and graduated from Rancho High School in 2014. Naajee worked as a Security Guard and recently accepted an apprenticeship in Construction. 

He departed his life on March 6, 2019 and was preceded in death by his father, Winston R. Johnson Jr., uncles Felix Johnson and Don Johnson.

item.title: Noel Bright
item.description:
Sunrise: December 9, 1970             Sunset: February 16, 2019
Noel Peter Bright, the son of Edna Earl Bright and the late Jessie Bright Jr., was born December 09. 1970 in Las Vegas, Nevada. He was the third of their four children. 

Noel grew up in North Las Vegas area and made many friends throughout the city. Noel graduated from Rancho High School where he played foot ball and ran track. From his humble beginnings of a child, he gave his life to Christ. He was baptized at Pilgrim Rest Baptist Church. 

Noel never married, but he met and had a relationship with Dana Skinner and from this love, their daughter Cierra Noel Bright was born. Noel met and had a relationship with Macona Connie Harris and from this love, their son, Micah Harris-Bright was born.

Noel had a kind heart and biggest smile that would light up a room full of people. He loved helping others and making everyone laugh. Noel had a passion for fishing, playing cards and dominoes, having those backyard BBQ's and entertaining people.

He was always so funny and fun to be around; and he was blessed with a quick wit. Noel's favorite songs was "2 Cleva 4 Eva." Noel was a natural born leader and he touched many lives.

item.title: Damarian Love
item.description:
Sunrise: May 16, 2017                  Sunset: February 14, 2019
Damarion Quince Love was born May 16th, 2007. He passed away in Washington, DC on February 14th. It saddens me Damarion Love wasn't even 12 years old when our father called him home due to health. God didn't believe in him struggling much longer. we still had memories to create, we are beyond thankful for the memories that he left behind. 

He has two beautiful parents Sherry Stevenson and Anthony Love. they raised a fine young man that loved basketball and the PlayStation 4.

Damarion later moved to Wilmington, Delaware where he attended Bayard Middle School. 

Damarion wouldn't want us to be sad. He'll want us to live on with memories that he left us. Even thought it's hard to say goodbye. It's never goodbye he'll forever live in our hearts. and watch over us in every single day with that annoying laugh ad beautiful smile of his. Damarion was a young beautiful spirit that will forever be missed by us all. I know all the family and friends are afraid to say goodbye. It's never to late to speak to him through prayer. 

February 14th was a nightmare, we lost a genuine soul here on earth. Damarion's at peace with the lord. He had a love so strong and pure. He brought so much joy to our lives. We'll forever be grateful for the love he left behind.

We love Damarion Quince Love, just know this isn't our final goodbye. Lord wrap your arms around him as he rest in paradise as the beautiful angel he is.

In loving memory of Damarion Quince Love, he leaves behind six beautiful sisters ad four loving brothers to cherish his memories. 
]]>

item.title: Joycelyn Chaney
item.description:
Sunrise: October 4, 1936               Sunset: February 12, 2019
Joycelyn Toney Chaney, affectionately called 'Joyce" was born on October 4, 1935 in Pioneer, LA to the parentage of Bessie and Theodore Toney, Sr. She was the fourth of six children from this union. Her siblings, Sammie, Milma, Theodore, Jr., Leroy and Sherman all preceded her in death. 

The Toney family relocated from Pioneer, LA to Las Vegas, NV in the 1940's, where Joyce remained an enduring resident. 

She accepted Christ as her Lord and Savior and participated in church activities at an early age. She joined Pilgrim Rest Missionary Baptist Church under the direction of Rev. E.C. Kline. Later she became a member of Mountaintop Faith Ministries under guidance of Rev. Clinton House. She was very actively involved in the culinary ministry while serving there. She returned to Pilgrim Rest, and at the tie of her demise, she was actively under the leadership of Rev. McKinley Hardman Jr,. where she was a member of the Hospitality Committee. During her time at Pilgrim Rest, she worked  in various capacities throughout the church.

Joyce began her formal education in the Louisiana Public School System and continued in the Clark County Public School System when her family relocated to Las Vegas. 

She always enjoyed cooking and working with food. In fact, her culinary career began at age 14, when her father shook her awake one morning and announced, "Baby, I'm going to teach you how to make bread today." From that point on, she further honed her cooking skills at virtually at every hotel kitchen in Las Vegas. 

Joycelyn Toney met Lonnie Chaney in Las Vegas, NV and they were married on February 15, 1962. A beautiful blended family was created through this union to include their children. Alexander (Alex), Della Denise, Lonnie Jr.,  Linda, Lona and Sandra.

Joyce displayed an entrepreneurial spirit, determined to be her own boss and make a difference! She left a comfortable job in culinary occupation to open her first venture, "The Chat N Chew." From the she owned and operated several other diners/cafes/businesses in and around Las Vegas including: Chaney's Lake Mead Hickory Pit, Sunrise Jiffy Market. Park 2000, C's Cotton Club, Sophisticated Lady Hair and Nails (which she obtained for her daughter, Della Denise); and Sunrise Travel Club/Westside Charter Service. 

Joyce loved her family. she enjoyed spending time with them. and they FELT THE SAME about her. It seemed they got enough of each other. You could always find some family member at their house spending time with Joyce on any given day. Her daughter, Denise, refers to her mom as her "Road Dog!' She often says that the roles were reversed when it came to driving. Denise was "Miss Daisy" and Joyce was the chauffeur, as Joyce did most of the driving during travel around town.

She enjoyed people and especially young people. She was referred to as "Mama," by her children and grandchildren's friends. Everyone was welcome at her home. 

To demonstrate her love and dedication to young people, she sponsored the Sunrise Travel Club and the Womack Sophisticated Ladies Drill Teams. These were award-winning drill teams that were involved in various community events. Largely due to her support, they were able to travel and participate throughout the country.

Joyce will be remembered as a strong woman: ambitious, kind nurturing and full of compassion. She was such a giving person, who gave and opened her doors to many, including less fortunate. 

In the early evening of February 12, 2019, God saw fit in His wisdom to call Joycelyn Toney Chaney home to be with Him. Awaiting and rejoicing to see her son, Lonnie Jr.,  who departed this life on January 16, 2016 and her  great grandson, Donald Troutman, Jr., To God be the glory!
]]>

item.title: Alice McDonnell
item.description:
Sunrise: May 22, 1951                 Sunset: February 10, 2019
Alice Joyce Hankins was born on May 22, 1951, in Hollywood, California.There she lived with her birth mother and grandmother, Ruby Dixon. She is affectionately known to  us as Joyce, but she fondly spoke of her grandmother who referred to her as Alice and taught her the essence of being a young lady. Proper etiquette and manner was a must. She exemplified those traits throughout her life. 

As a young girl her father, Robert Wonderful Hankins become custodial parent and she moved with him and his wife Juanita to Las Vegas, NV. She spoke about her childhood home as being filled with pets, love and fruit trees. It was in this home that Alice received her to have spirit of excellence, incredible character, and exceptional work ethic.

One of her favorite scriptures was Isaiah 54:13, "And all my children shell be taught of the Lord, and great shall by the peace of thy children." This was definitely the case in childhood home. Bible study and prayer were the standard in the Hankins' home. At the age 12, destiny met purpose and the Hankins family moved three houses away from the Parson family. These families became friends and Joyce, her parents and sister, Edith, helped Elder and Mother Parson found what become Vegas View Church of God in Christ (COGIC). As a teenager Joyce found what became Choir, and Sunday School. Her thirst for knowledge was insatiable. Her level of intellect was amazing!Throughout her life she never stopped learning. The scripture Isaiah 54:13 and the skills and knowledge she gained as a teen and young woman at Vegas View was a driving force throughout her life as she led, developed and oversaw multiple youth auxiliaries and ministries, while raising three children. 

Joyce graduated from Rancho High School in 1969 and enrolled at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas. It was at Vegas View COGIC that Joyce met the love of her life Charles McDonnell. They married in October of 1972. Her circle of family grew as the McDonnell family was great in number.  They loved her as a sister. The Lord took Charles home in February of 193. She often spoke of how they were not just husband and wife, but good friends. Together they birth three beautiful children: Jabari, Jamila and Janina. She always put them first. They were her blessing and greatest joy. When necessary,  she worked two jobs to make their needs were met. Jabari, Jamila and Janina were active in school, church and sports. She cultivated a home life that was nurturing and structured. Although she was busy with work and church, she always took the time for her children. They often went to the movies or gathered in front of the TV for quality time. She was a mother and role model. She was a confidant and comforter. She encouraged and disciplined. She was a good cook and passed that passion on to her daughters. Everyone knows her macaroni and cheese was the best! She was intentional in her love for her children. It began with their names, of which she was so proud of. Jabari means brave. Jamila means beautiful. Janina means God is gracious. She was everything a mother should be and more. 


]]>

Reggie was best known for being well dressed, looking good, driving flashy cars and his watch collection.

After completing high school, he received an opportunity to attend and play football at the College of Desert in Palm Desert, CA. Victor moved back to Las Vegas and attended the college of Southern Nevada so he would be close to home. Victor was a member of Tried Stone Missionary Baptist Church.

Victor began his professional career in 2012, when he completed the rigorous training at the American Institute of Trucking, Las Vegas, Nevada. He was certified with a CDL Class A license to drive doubles triples, tankers, and hazmat trucks. Victor often picked up and delivered cargo, worked overnight shifts and many long hours.

item.title: Robert Millner
item.description:
Sunrise: May 8, 1966              Sunset: January 29, 2019
Robert "Bob" Millner III was born May 8, 1966 in Las Vegas, Nevada to Mr. Robert Millner Jr. & Mrs. Delores Millner. 
 
Robert, better known as "Bob" grew up in Las Vegas, Nevada and attended William L. Ferron Elementary School, Jo Mackey Sixth Grade Center, Woodbury Jr. High School, then graduated from Chaparral High School. Bob's love for the sport of football, which he played very well, from Pop-Warner through high school earned him the opportunity to attend Antelope Valley College where he continued his education while playing the sport he loved so  much. After his 2 year period at Antelope Valley College, Bob transferred to Imperial Valley College where he continued playing football as well as furthering his education. 

Bob was a member of Tried Stone Missionary Baptist Church where he served as a loyal member. He was constantly seen monitoring the church facility during services to ensure the safety and security for the church goers until he was no longer able to do so.
