item.title: Ralph Lewis Sr.
item.description:
Sunrise: November 19, 1956                         Sunset: January 18, 2019                
Mr. Ralph Lewis, Sr., the fourth child of Alvin & Bertha Lee Lewis was born in November 19, 1956 in Compton, California. Ralph attended public schools of Compton and graduated from Compton High School in 1974. after graduating high school he began work for Boeing: The Boeing Company as a Structural Mechanic. On November, 17, 1979, he married the love of his life, Jacquelyn Kilgore. A month before they were to celebrate their first son, Ralph, Jr, (October 1980). Three years later would come their second son, Christopher Armand (September 1983). Many years later, they were blessed with a little girl that they named Marcell Denise (May 1997).

Ralph worked as hard and consistently to provide for his family. After dedicating 36 years of service, working the dreaded graveyard shift he retired in 2014. After retirement, Ralph moved to North Las Vegas, Nevada to his second  home where he would become closer to his grandchildren.  A a retiree he simply lived lie and enjoyed every moment. Ralph was always freshly dressed and always eager to go different places and try new things. He enjoyed being out and about with family and friends, golfing, attending sporting events and taking trips with the fellas. You could always tell when "Pops" was at home relaxing because he would call the kids a few times a day to talk about anything that came to mind or to ensure plans made the previous day were still to go. His warm smile and unforgettable laugh brightened many days and welcomed many people. 

On Friday, January 18, 2019, Ralph Lewis, Sr. passed away unexpectedly in his home. although Ralph had plans to Attend Raiders games as a loyal fan, travel and spend more time with his family and friends, the family finds comfort in knowing he enjoyed his life to the fullest. 
]]>

item.title: Thurston Winfree
item.description:
Sunrise: September 12, 1959               Sunset: January 18, 2019
Thurston David Winfree was born on September 12, 1959, to Lewis Paul Winfree and Dorothy Evelyn Winfree in Huntingdon, Pennsylvania. 

Thurston was educated at Mt. Area High School and graduated from Altoona Area High School in 1978. He was active in several high school activities, including The Boy Scouts and he played saxophone in the band.

Thurston was a member of Mt. Hope Baptist Missionary Church in Mt. Union, PA. He had a deep love for music, and he passionately expressed it through DJ'ing for over 30 years. He was so eloquently dubbed, DJ Winjam. Thurston started his military career in the Air Force in 1978. He later moved to Las Vegas, Nevada in 1979 to continue his military career. Thurston enjoyed helping others and spending time with his family and friends. 
]]>

item.title: Reggie Christensen
item.description:
Sunrise: May 27, 1976     Sunset: January 14, 2019
Reggie Christensen was born on May 27th, 1976 in Las Vegas, Nevada to Don and Dorothy Christensen. Reggie was the second born child of Don and Dorothy Christensen union. On January 14, 2019 Reggie peacefully answered his heavenly call home.

Reggie a Native of Las Vegas attended Western High School. Reggie worked at Walker Furniture for 8 years. In his leisure time Reggie loved working on cars and enjoying time participating with his car club OneLuv. Reggie was known for his lavish taste in cars. He loved taking a car from nothing and making it something. Reggie never rode alone, he always had one of his children by his side.

In the year of 1997 Reggie met Cherise Clary also of Las Vegas, Nevada. The two were joined together in Holy Matrimony in the year 2000. Reggie and Cherise shared 22 years of marriage. In their marriage they were blessed with 5 loving children. Reggie was a father like no other, his family was his pride and joy! He enjoyed going to the children's games and cheering them on. Reggie was also blessed with 5 grandchildren.

Reggie also loved spending time with family, playing dominos, spades or just engaging in conversation. Reggie always greeting you with a smile, he was always happy to see family! He was truly a soul that will be dearly missed.
]]>

item.title: Major Walker
item.description:
Sunrise: June 10, 1958               Sunset: January 7, 2019
Our beloved brother, son, father, uncle, cousin and friend passed away on Monday, January 7, 2019. Major was born June 10, 1958 in Saginaw, Michigan to the late Ollie Walker Johnson and Leffie D. Walker 1. 

Major was a fun-loving child who enjoyed his family. Major played the drums, loved to cook, he loved to sing, and he was an avid sports fan. He loved the Dallas Cowboys. Major accepted Christ in 1968 under the leadership of the late Nathaniel Whitney of the Greater Evergreen Missionary Baptist Church. 

Major was an honor student at Rancho High School and graduated at 16 in 1975. In 1976 he relocated to Saginaw, Michigan and started working for General Motors. In late 1977, he returned to Las Vegas, Nevada and started working at Nevada Test Site. On March 17, 1978 he married Vivian Dottery. In late years, Major went to school driving trucks. Major worked for Fleet Delivery Service for a couple of years, then he went to work for Warner's Trucking Company. Major will be remembered for his sense of style, his hearty laughter, his love of music, old T.V. shows on TV land. Major's mother Ollie Walker Johnson, proceeded him in death. 
]]>

item.title: Bobbie Owens
item.description:
Sunrise: April 18, 1944              Sunset: January 17, 2019
Sister Bobbie Jean Owens was born to George and Virginia Larry on April 18, 1944 in Newellton, LA. She was the 5th of six children. She attended Ruben McCall High School in Tallulah LA, and graduated in 1962. 

Sister Bobbie worked at the Sands Hotel and Flamingo Hotel as a Housekeeping Supervisor and retired in 2005.

Sister Bobbie accepted Jesus Christ as her Lord and Savior at an early age. After relocating to Las Vegas NV, she joined Greater Evergreen Missionary Baptist Church under leadership of her late brother-in-law Nathaniel Whitney Sr., where she faithfully served as a member of the usher as a strong soldier until December 25, 2017 when she suffered a stroke. God in his infinite wisdom granted us the privilege of sharing more time and love with her. Our lives have been tremendously impacted from the loss of the last Larry sibling.

]]>

item.title: Estella Terry
item.description:
Sunrise: December 31, 1928              Sunset: December 22, 2018
To my Family, Friends this story is written by Estella V. Terry on one Saturday morning at 7:30 am. "Poope you will have to have any sisters help finish this because I am too full. 

Estella V. The Child grew up on 3543 So. Prairie Ave. alongside the Howard Family and loving aunts, uncles and cousins. Estella had a deep love of Jesus Christ because Dollie & Willie kept all their children close t o their savior Jesus Christ. At the age of 9yrs old Estella was baptized under the leadership of Reverend William Bailey Sr. she joined the First Gideon Baptist Church in  Chicago, IL.

Estella V. The Student attended Raymond Grammar School of Windells Phillips High School. 

Estella V. The Young Woman met Johnnye Jr. Henry D, Terry's brother who introduced the two. Henry and Estella both hit off. Estella went to the show with the brothers to see a John Wayne movie. The name of the movie was "the High and Mighty" and John Wayne made a personal appearance.  

Afterword, the dating continued, quick trips to Jew town to eat delicious polishes and pork sandwiches. Henry and Estella would attend weekend card games at the Uncle Calvin's house and the Ross's fell in love with Estella. Their special courtship led to marriage in 1955. 

Estella V. The Wife and husband moved to 79th and Eberhart and lived with  her sister and brother in law, Monroe and Ida Jackson. In 1958, Ida Mae and Estella were both pregnant at the same times. Estella and Henry's only child Henry D. Terry Jr. was born on September 22, 1958. Dollie Mae named Henry Poope, however, his grandfather called him Purch, his grandmother called him Poochie Boy and Stella affectionately called him Poope. This special only child was loved everyday of his life and his mother dressed him in the finest of clothes that money could buy.  Estella wrapped her child in unconditional remarkable love. Which resonated and developed one of the most loving men God has working for him on earth. 

The  best Cooks out of them Howard girls was Willa Mae & Estella V. The best pound cakes, salmon croquet's, deep fried shrimps, greens extraordinaire, cabbage, chicken, string beans and cornbread. 

Estella The Worker Estella started working at the age of 16 years old and didn't stop until her retirement. She first worked as a supervisor for four years at Neisners 5 & 10 store located at 47th Calumet. Then Western Electric for 9 years. Estella worked two jobs at many intervals in her career. Estella worked at the United States Postal Worker and for the Chicago Police Department as a dispatcher for many years. Finally, Estella decided to take care of children by running The Burn Unit at Cook County Hospital until retirement. 

Estella V. The Mother cared for her beloved son. As a child I was very sick and practically no immune system as a result of Asthma. My mother carried me to hospitals back and forth for many years, one day at a time. I remember numerous trips to Dr. Thomkins office on 63rd and Marylands and then 75th and Dr, Martin Luther King Drive. Then we would go to Barbara Jeans and Madison  House to enjoy the family times with my cousin Alicia. Or we would take 76th street to Lucy and Freddie's house, we would even stop by Mr. and Mrs. Jacksons house because we had family all over the south side of Chicago. My mother would drive me to Evergreen Plaza where the owner of Mr. Lees Men's Clothing s would fit me into tailor made suites from the ages of eight years old until I was a teenager. My mother introduce me into the Drive In Theatre on 74th Street behind Zayres. My mother taught me manners. My mother paid for a private school  at Sacred Heart for eight years. My mother taught me along with my Grandmother Dollie and Willie the responsibility it was to live in the Big House at 6839 Aberdeen. we were the second Black Family on the block. My memories of my Mother are inundated with Love, Block Parties, twenty trips to OK's Store across the street, The BEST Neighbor Experience a child or teenager could imagine. My Mother saved lives sitting in her second floor window watching ,praying, and shouting out the window to Alonzo, Bobby, Robert Lee, The Reeds, The Langrones, Mary Myrick, the Humphries and on and on. 

Estella The Grandmother Estella was the grandma of four. Tryrell Michael, Ryan Leslie, Katelynn Virginia and Henry David III whom she loved dearly. Her joy and happiness gleamed as a result of her grandchildren. No mother loved their children as hard as she loved me. Her health challenge never removed her memory of the four wonderful grandchildren of hers. My mother went to higher level of appreciation when she became a great grandmother to Zaryon, Tryell Jr. (Butterball). Zachary, Zara and out latest addition Zeda. 

﻿Henry The son & Caretaker ﻿Message to every son who has the privilege of taking care of your mother in the winter of their life. Your reasonable service is to c are, feed, hug, embrace, spend quality time, and supply any need your mother may have. I want every ear that can hear and every eye that can see to know that my wife never complained, refused, or measured what I did or spent on my mother's needs. I supplemented myself to her well being because I had found my niche in life and my family was comfortable with my compromise. My mother for 60 years was the attached angel, confidant, precious friend and grandmother to my children. Mother to my very soul that God created because she was wonderfully made in His image is very reason our hearts connected so. The maker of the heart is God Shella and Poope are separated for a minute, her heart needs to be with her maker alongside the two hearts she missed the most....Dollie and Willie! See YA! Poochie Man 
]]>

item.title: Kristy Lynn Day
item.description:
Sunrise: November 6, 1974               Sunset: December 30, 2018
Kristy Lynn Day was born November 6, 1974 in Las Vegas, NV to Ronald Lewis Day, Sr. and Barbara Day. She was the first of three children born to this union. Her father preceded her in death.

After graduating high school in 1993, Kristy attended beauty school on a scholarship for one year. Upon completion, she tried her hand at different occupations looking for her fit in life. Kristy worked at Whiskey Pete's Hotel & Casino, at Macy's, and Dollar Rent-A-Car before finding her niche in life. She found that she enjoyed the personal relationship that she could have with her clientele and decided that she preferred doing hair in comparison to the jobs that she had previously chosen.She built a database of clients as a Hairdresser that supported her and her children until her time of death. Kristy possessed a work ethic that was unreal. With this desire to succeed, she supported herself and her children. She knew her worth.

Kristy married Gary Shelton in 1998 and to this union two children were born. Her marriage ended in divorce and she maintained an amicable relationship with her ex-husband until her time of death. She added to her family in 2015 and she called them her trinity.

Kristy was baptized in the Name of Jesus here at the Church of the Lord Jesus where her grandmother is the Pastor. She attended church during her adult life and had a close relationship with God. Kristy was a very intelligent soul and had a way with words. She had her catch phrases that included Yessir, BAYBEEEEE Listen, It's been real. 

 
]]>

item.title: Derwin Rhodes
item.description:
Sunrise: December 21, 1996            Sunset: December 22, 2018
Derwin "Dee" Lamar Rhodes age 49 of North Las Vegas, NV peacefully transitioned to his heavenly home on Saturday, December 22, 2018 at 2:43am.

Derwin was born Sunday, December 21, 1969 at 9:53pm at the Community Hospital of Springfield and Clark County in Springfield, OH to Virgena Rhodes of Springfield, OH & Gregory Gray of Dayton, OH. A native of Springfield, Dee was educated in the Springfield Public School System where where he graduated from North High School on June 2. 1988.

On June 24, 1988 Dee joined the United States Air Force (USAF). Training took him to Lackland AFB-TX, Sheppad AFB-TX and Andrews AFB-MD before he was stationed at Little Rock AFB-AR as a Medical Laboratory Technician. Dee was a Veteran of the Gulf War serving during Operation Desert Shield/ Desert Storm and received an Air Force Good Conduct Medal, National Defense Service Medal & Air Force Training Ribbon.  Dee received an Honorable Discharge on June 24, 1992. Dee began his career in 1995 as a Federal Employee with the United States Government as a Medical Laboratory Technician while his wife was stationed at Sembach AFB-Germany. 

While stationed at Little Rock, Dee met the love of his life Jacqueline "Jackie" Yvette Reed at a Christmas parade on Saturday, December 2, 1989. Awakened from a nap with an engagement ring on her finger Dee proposed to Jackie on June 20, 1990. They married on April 20, 1991 and traveled the world during Jackie's 20 year carer in the USAF with tours of duty at Sembach, Little Rock, Pope AFB- NC, Keesler -AFB - MS- GA and Nellis AFB- NV. In 1997 they started their family and 5 children were born of this union. Upon Jackie's retirement they decided to remain in Las Vegas so Dee could perfect his golf game. 

Derwin was a devoted and loving husband and father who enjoyed life by spending  time with his family and traveling. a passionate fitness buff who enjoyed the gym, golfing, racquetball, basketball, baseball, singing, dancing, card and board games, tea aficionado and puzzles. Dee completed his 1st triathlon at Keesler. Dee completed in the Toughman Boxing Contest at Keesler and received the 2nd place trophy & jacket. Dee completed the Tough Mudder Fitness Competition while residing in Las Vegas. He was an avid Boston Celtics fab as well as Philadelphia Eagles fan who rejoiced unabashedly in their 2018 Super Bowl Championship season. Dee was known for his kids spirit, humming, loving and compassionate heart, infectious smile and laughter which made it impossible for you not to love him once you met him. He will be truly and deeply missed.  





]]>

item.title: Henry Coates
item.description:
Sunrise: March 26, 1936          Sunset: November 30, 2018
Henry Lee Coates was born March 26, 1931, in Birmingham, Alabama to Roosevelt and Emma Coates. Henry was the oldest of two, he had a younger sister named Pearl.

Henry graduated from high school in Alabama. He marched for our rights alongside Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Henry would share stories with his kids about getting watered down by them strong hoses and the police dogs trying to attack him.

In 1975, Henry, his mother and sister moved to California. Henry then met his wife Catherine in 1976, and on September 11, 1976 they got married. Joining the couple were 8 children and life for them changed. Henry was a hard-working man, he worked from 1976 to 1998 at Ace Hardware Warehouse, which he retired from and they moved to Las Vegas, Nevada. Henry just couldn't sit still, so he got a job at Wackenhut Security where he worked there for two years. Henry and Catherine or in his words "Cat" then moved to Moreno Valley, California with their daughter Michelle.

Henry enjoyed cleaning the house on the weekends, watering the plants, recycling his cans, washing his car, and taking Cat to Jack N' the Box every morning. He loved spending time with family, watching his western shows and especially watching "The Lakers" 

Henry was a man of few words, but when you actually took the time out to sit down and talk with him, he was a man of wisdom and full of laughs.

Ella also enjoyed singing, fishing, and playing the drums in church. Her cooking was amazing, everyone loved it. Ella cooked for pre-school kids at a Christina Church; the pastor even fell in love with her cooking. She also cared for many people mentally and physically Ella helped a lot of people she was always willing to go the extra mile for anyone. Her family was always first Priority. item.title: Jesus Miguel Butanda-Miranda
item.description:
Sunrise: October 4, 1957            Sunset: December 12, 2018
Jesus Miguel Butanda-Miranda was born on October 4, 1957 to the union of Domingo Butanda and Mariaester Veneges - Miranda in Mexico City, Mexico.

He spent his childhood in Mexico and later moved to America as a young adult. He was married to his first wife in 1976; they welcomed their son, Eleodoro, on October 17, 1977 and their daughter, Elvira, on December 12, 1979.

He later moved to Las Vegas, Nevada where he lived the remainder of his life. He married his wife, Maria Campos, on November 14, 2004; together they raised two boys; Orlando and Jorge.

Jesus' family, friends, and work were the most important parts of his life.He was a skilled craftsman of many trades including: farming, carpentry, plumbing, electricity, and rigging. He was employed at Freeman as a Rigging Journeyman for 18 years. He was known as a problem-solver who often took on difficult or unwanted projects at work and around the house. He was a hardworking man who worked from dusk to dawn rarely taking a day off.

He also enjoyed fishing, spending time with family and friends, traveling to Mexico, listening to banda music, watching his favorite teams: the Miami Dolphins and Club America.

He lived his life with honor, integrity, and pride and had great passion for his Mexican values, heritage, and culture.

item.title: Galean Simon
item.description:
Sunrise: October 13, 1980               Sunset: December 5, 2018
Galean Ramon Simon was born October 13, 1980 in Lakeview Terrance, California to Karrol Janice Boyd and Ray Stanely Simon. His parents were overjoyed to have a little boy and his big sister, Monique enjoyed having a new baby brother even though she wanted a little sister. as a single parent, their mother worked long hours so the extended family became the village in raising her children. 

As a small boy, Galean  grew and bonded with his grandfather, Herbert Boyd Jr., because they lived in the same home. As a very small child Galean developed a passion for sports and loved watching sports of any kind with his uncles Herbert Jr on TV. at the ear;y age of five, Galean had a desire to to have a "job" and got to work! Even though he was not allowed, he would go to the gas station on his skateboard and pump people's gas for money. It is here where he learned the value of work ethic and entrepreneurship- he found a way and creates his own income stream. 

In 1990 things changed for Monique and Galean when their mother became terminally ill with cancer. Before she died, she discussed the care of her children with her sister, Etta and her husband Darryl, requesting them to care for and raise her children as their own. They graciously agreed to love and raise them as their own and as a bonus there were blessed with the baby sister, Clara. 

As Galean grew older, he and Darryl developed a close father-son bond. As a teenager, Galean had some challenges in school ad started goofing off in class, but always realized the importance of education. He enjoyed family gatherings with his cousins and was always the BIG protector of all his female cousins. His love for sports continued gravitating towards basketball and boxing, but also started to have some interest in music. Noticing Galean's interest in music, his aunt and uncle allowed him to have a music studio in their home, and began nurturing his passion for music into a career. With Galean's lively and magnetic personality, people were automatically drawn to him, so his aunt and uncle began adopting all of his friends into their ever-expanding family. At the age of 19, Galean graduated from Desert Winds High School, Lancaster in 1999.

Fresh out of high school Galean begin following his uncle Darryl's food steps and begin assisted him with cooking and catering jobs. While catering, he discovered club promoting and started to learn the promotion business within the club scene. In this platform, he had the opportunity to perform his music that he loved so much. Being a large man he found it had its perks as well and occasionally worked as a club bouncer. 

Navigating between different career interest, Galean was never truly happy in California, so in his early 2000's he moved to Las Vegas his uncle Herbert and aunt Pam lived. He quickly found work in the club scene as a bouncer while still promoting, performing, and his passion in the music industry. Galean's life would still take another turn when he met the love of his life, Andrea Patterson, in July 2012. As their relationship grew he proposed on St. Patrick's Day 2014 and called his sisters and mother to announce he had fallen in love and would be marrying Andrea. He brought her home that Christmas 2014 along with her son, Damariyae, to meet the family. They were married on May 23rd 2015. As Galean and Andrea began to build a life together, his relationship with Damariyae also flourished into a father-son bond with plans to expand their little family with the new addition to the family. 

Galean had recently joined the construction crew as a cement worker at the new Raiders Stadium and was looking forward to being a part of his monumental opportunity . unfortunately,,on December 05, 2018 Galean's life was senselessly taken during an altercation attempting to protect his family. We will always remember Galean R Simon as a loving husband, dedicated father, beloved brother, son and uncle. In our hearts he always by our Superman and always out Hero! 


]]>

item.title: Guy Banks III
item.description:
Sunrise: April 3, 1999          Sunset: November 3, 2018
Parents Nina Davie & Guy Lee Banks Jr. were completely overjoyed when their first child Guy Lee Banks III was born on April 3, 1993 at Sunrise Hospital in Las Vegas, Nevada. He was the sweetest and cutest little boy. He loved to play with his toys, and especially his cars! he never traveled anywhere without at least without at least one Hot Wheel. He could play "cars" for hours alone or with company. When he was just an infant he was affectionately given the nick name "Guy Guy" by his cousin which his family and close friends call him to this day. Anyone who knew Guy Guy would say how polite,  well mannered, and quiet he was. One of his proudest life experiences was definitely being a GREAT big brother and having a loving relationship with his younger siblings: Jalon, Ayi, Keion, Rylie, Gianna, and Kiyori. He spoiled his sisters so much that he wouldn't allow Rylie to go upstairs without him carrying her although she could walk on her own. He would tuck her in at night, attend all of her extra curricular activities and help his parents with keeping all of them safe and happy. Although he and his brother Jalon fought occasionally, they always threw in the towel to spend countless hours playing video games together. Guy loved to listen to music too.

Guy Guy loved sports, during his childhood he participated in many extra curricular activities such as baseball and football. He enjoyed playing basketball with his Dad, uncles, cousins, and friends. His favorite sports teams were the Green Bay packers and the LA Lakers. He loved to watch the Green Bay Packers while playing dominoes at his aunt Angie's home with her and his uncle as they are also big fans. Since a young boy he aspired to play baseball and was looking to participate in a local team before his demise. Guy Guy always fought hard to do well in Elementary School, Junior High and High School was no different. He graduated from Desert Pines High School in the Spring of 2018. He spoke of how happy he was that his family from both sides were there to celebrate him during his graduation. He worked hard to become independent and he loved kids so he gained employment at the Boys & Girls Club during and after graduating high school, before taking on two jobs at UPS and Republic Services that he was employed at the time of his demise. His demeanor was so respected that he was even given the nickname "Uncle Guy" by the barbershop whenever he went to Leemah to keep his "fade fresh". They said he had such an old soul. He was studying for the ASVAB to join the Air Force and was an active participant in the voting process as he voted early last week. 

Anyone who knew or met Guy Guy would surely tell you these same words: "he was always a happy person, his smile was contagious, and little shy, considerate and kind" - almost to a fault. Naturally, he made friends and had the same group of friends since childhood. He loved hanging out with his aunts, uncles and cousins. 

His aunt laughed about how he was so excited to have a car, that he popped up with two of his closest friends to hang out with his "TT Toya and Uncle Rick". She bragged about how happy she was to hang out with them and how special she felt that the boys enjoyed their company (or the food), so much that they were pushing back the time to hang out with their girlfriends that day. Since a baby, napping was his favorite past time. He would nap whenever he could even while riding from one end of town to the next!

Guy Guy was 19 at the age of his passing. 
]]>

item.title: Verlene Taylor
item.description:
Sunrise: July 11, 1937          Sunset: November 10, 2018
Verlene Taylor was born on July 11, 1937 to the union of Laura Mae and George Jesse Taylor. Verlene was baptized at an early age. By GOD's "Amazing Grace" 55 (Fifty-Five) years ago, Mother Verlene Taylor joined Second Baptist Church, under the leadership of Reverend L.C Coleman, located in Las Vegas, Nevada, where she remained faithfully committed until the day that she transitioned to he "Heavenly Home". As she would always say. "When You Hear of My Homegoing, Don't Worry About Me" 

﻿Verlene attended public school by way of Carthage High School in Arkansas where she graduated. After leaving Fordyce, AK, Verlene relocated to Las Vegas in the Year of 1962, where she immediately started a family and was extremely excited to be a Proud Mother of 11 (Eleven Children). With her "Ultra-Determined" attitude, she fiercely sought employment. Her first jobs were at the Landmark Hotel and Caesars Palace. After leaving Caesars Palace she joined the Nevada Test Site and tirelessly worked there until she retired in 1995.

﻿Everyone and anyone who crossed her path knew her as a "Tell It Like It Is Woman", ﻿leaving no stones unturned. Additionally, she was a caring person who truly Loved The Lord and most of all her unwavering commitment to the Church. Her children was her proudest accomplishments who she doted on and loved dearly. She will be remembered for her canny sense of humor, flawless love of wearing fashionable clothes as well as hats.

﻿God found cause to call Verlene Home to be with him on November 10, 2018, as she transitioned peacefully at her home. Although she will be truly missed by many near and far, her memories  will live on forever.
]]>

item.title: Teddy Seals
item.description:
Sunrise: September 9, 1979          Sunset: October 27, 2018
Teddy Lee Seals was born on September 9, 1979 at Southern Memorial Hospital in Las Vegas, Nevada to Emma Cranford and Terry Lee Seals, who both proceeded him in death.

Teddys' life was tragically taken on October 27, 2018.

Teddy, affectionately known as 'Teddy Bea" was raised by Ethel Bea Cranford. She raised him to be the man that he was until 1988 when god called her home. Teddy Bea was raised in Marble Manor. He attended schools within the Clark County School District and he graduated from Cimarron Memorial High School where he played football. Teddy Bea was the jack of all trades. He worked in many funeral homes; the last funeral home was at Serenity Funeral Home. He transported to and from various funeral homes and gravesites. He enjoyed helping and assisting families with the burial of their loved ones.

Teddy Bea loved his children. Always making time for his kids. Teddy Bea is still loved by so many people. If you knew him, he kept you laughing and he always had jokes. Teddy Bea was always at the Fiesta Hotel watching his favorite team, the Giants; this is where he would meet up with his many friends and love ones to enjoy watching the games.

item.title: Bruce Anderson
item.description:
Sunrise: August 27, 1948         Sunset: October 17, 2018

Brother Bruce Edward Anderson was born on August 27, 1948 in Evansville Indiana to the late Augustus & Nancy Anderson. The Anderson family resided in Evansville Indiana. Brother Anderson accepted the Lord at an early age and he served in the church as a musician and singer. He came from a musical family, where he learned to play the piano and sang. Music was brother Anderson’s passion. Brother Anderson attended and graduated from Benjamin Bosse High School from there he attended The University of Southern Indiana. Brother Anderson was drafted into the United States Air force and he served as an entertainer for the Military.


Brother Anderson was a loyal and devoted husband and a great father. He was a praying man, he loved the Lord. Brother Anderson traveled the world as a musician. He relocated to Las Vegas in 1974. Brother Anderson was employed by EG&G until he retired. Brother Anderson departed this life on October 17, 2018 due to long term illness. He leaves to mourn his lovely wife Gail, two sons Tyler & Jason, and one Daughter Judith Jackson of Las Vegas, NV. Four sisters, Joyce (Walter) Robinson of Dallas TX, Iris ( Brian) Pirtle, Kansas City, MO, Alexis Rainbow of Jacksonville, TN, Gayl Anderson of Las Vegas, NV. One brother Brad Anderson of Paddington, IN. He leaves to mourn four grandchildren, and three great grandchildren and a number of nieces, nephews, cousins and friends.

]]>

item.title: Shirley Siebert
item.description:
Sunrise: December 21, 1957                 Sunset: October 13, 2018
 Shirley Jean set forth on this earthly journey on December 21, 1957 in Las Vegas, NV. Born to the late Clyde D. Straughter and Julia Mae Troutman. Shirley attended Clark County School District and graduated from Western High School. She was a beautiful person inside and out, who loved people and always had her nieces and nephews over to her house. Shirley was employed at an early age where she worked at Nevada State Bank for 25 years. After her retirement she was employed with McCarran Airport, The Hilton Hotel and Clark County School District, retiring in 2016.

 Shirley accepted Christ at an early age, reading her bible every day until the Lord said " Well done my child" Shirley was a member of the Greater St. James Missionary Baptist Church, under the leadership of Reverend Donnell Horn. Shirley enjoyed basketball and baseball. She was always at the park playing basketball with her sons. Always making sure to bring along her nieces and nephews. She played on the Hilton Hotel softball team with her sister Lois. The El Cortez was a favorite hangout for Shirley, her mother, sisters, and brothers, hanging out until the wee hours and enjoying each other.

 While enjoying her life, Shirley gave her heart to the late James C. Coleman Sr. This union birth three handsome sons James, Mario, and Derek, two preceding her in death. In 1991, she met and married Tommie Siebert until God called him home. Shirley has always been a devoted and loving wife and mother. On October 13, 2018 the earthly life of Shirley Siebert was called to her Heavenly home. Her legacy will always continue to live on because she loved everyone, and everyone loved her. Shirley has always was ever giving and a great example of true love.

Shirley was known as "Shelly" to her family and friends, but to her granddaughter she was "Bubbles". Shirley was a living witness to the abundance of love on Earth, always offering sweet words of encouragement or prayers for all who encountered her. Her smile is unforgettable. 
]]>

When he came to Las Vegas, he loved his family dearly very energetic and a hard working man that he was going to make sure they were taken care of. He loved to cut hair, because he saw that was a sign to make a person feel good about themselves after a good haircut. He loved to dress and dressed well indeed he did. item.title: Arnita Thomas
item.description:
Sunrise: January 7, 1979           Sunset: September 27, 2018             
  Arnita Thomas was born January 7, 1962 in Las Vegas, Nevada, to Martha and Francis Edward Thomas. The family lost their parents at a young age and were cared for and nurtured by their older brother, Nathaniel Scott. Reared in Historical West Las Vegas, Arnita successfully matriculated through the Clark County School District Educational System. In 1974, Arnita moved to California to live with her sister, Barbara Scott.

  After earning her High School diploma, Arnita entered West Los Angeles College to pursue an administration degree. Several years later she began working as a secretary at Luster Henry Tutorial Center.

  She later moved back to Las Vegas where she entered the hotel industry, working at Imperial Palace and Sahara Hotels. She enjoyed working in hotel hospitality. For many years leading up to her passing, she worked other various jobs, including Greater Evergreen Missionary Baptist Church as a maintenance technician. She was very passionate about cleaning and maintaining the upkeep of the House of the Lord.

  As a child, Arnita was brought up in the church. She attended the Vegas view Church of God in Christ under Pastor Claude H. Pastor Jr. and Mother Stella Parson. She later accepted Christ at Bethany Baptist Church of West Los Angeles, under the leadership of the late Rev. Rocellia Johnson. She served on various ministries, but her favorite was singing in the mass choir.

  Arnita enjoyed fashion, cooking, gospel music, and gardening. Being quite fashionable, she loved shopping for the latest trends. Arnita also watched food tutorials and cooking channels during her spare time. The center and heart of her life was her son. She was an exemplary mother who taught her son about Christ, helped with homework, and participated in activities.

Richard then left Ft. Worth, TX and moved to Milwaukee, WI in 1974 with 2 of his aunts; Ms. Vera and Mrs. Everline, where he worked at AO Smith. Richard then met Bobbie Barnett in August of 1973 and they dated for about 5 years.

In 1978, Richard relocated to Las Vegas, NV with Bobbie Barnett and shortly after they moved to Las Vegas, NV Richard was employed at the Silverbird Hotel & Casino until they closed. Tyrese Lashawn Traylor was born on June 11, 2000, to Monique Traylor and Allen Griffin Sr., in Las Vegas, Nevada. Tyrese later followed Pastor Earl Henry and joined the New Paradise Baptist Church, where he took a liking to God's Chosen youth choir, where he was able to express himself through song and dance.

Tyrese was a loving young man with an infectious smile. He attended Clark High School, before transitioning to Canyon Springs High School, where he was a natural born athlete at both schools. Any sport he played he excelled at and always strived to be the best. Some may considered him cocky, because he let everyone know "I'm the best" Tyrese recently completed culinary school and he was determined to prove he was the best.

Tyrese made time for his family and friends, and he was always willing to lend a helping hand if he was needed. Even though he was with us for a short period of time, he made an impact on everyone and he left us with many memories to cherish

item.description:
Sunrise: December 30, 1958           Sunset: August 16, 2018
Carolyn Sue Robinson was born on December 30, 1958 in Tallulah, Louisana, to the parents of Ethel Mae Robinson and Jesse James Lee.

Carolyn attended the Clark County School District. She received her diploma and graduated from Western High School in 1976. Carolyn was an avid reader, she loved playing video games and anything that had to do with syfy (movies, books and conventions). 

Her work experiences were as a property manager. Carolyn started her bus driving career with Para-transit and ended her 25 years of service with Sweet Water Tours. She loved driving and talking to the clients on the bus. Anyone who crossed Carolyn's path knew she was easy going and a very caring person.

During the time President Barack Obama was running for office, you would have thought Carolyn was also running. She was out campaigning, knocking on doors and making telephone calls. She was very passionate about elections and could have been a reporter for CNN and  MSNBC.

item.title: Michela Abbington
item.description:
Sunrise: September 11, 1970           Sunset: July 18, 2018
Affectionately known as "Binky" to her children and grandson and "Kala" to her family and friends. Michela Michelle was born on September 11, 1970 to Agnes (Ruthie) Abbington and Rex J. Abbington in Des Moines, Iowa. She attended elementary school there until the family moved to St. Louis, Mo. Michaela would soon after leave St. Louis to move with her family to Las Vegas, NV.

She was always a joyful child that was always happy and full of life. A firm believer in God. Any hymn she heard she either knew it or was eager to learn it. As life changed so did Michela, meeting a man she loved so much and having her first child at a young age, never losing faith in the Lord, Michela set out to build her own family having three additional beautiful children. Although Michela had some struggles throughout her young life, she always kept a bright shining glow about her and the most beautiful smile.

Michela was a music lover and artist at heart. Let's not forget how much she loved animals. Everyone she touched regarded Michela as a warm and loving woman with a heart of gold.

Feeding one's soul was Michela's specialty. She loved to see ones face after their stomach was full.She later became an in Home  Caregiver which brought so much happiness to her life.

GOD WAS READY FOR HER EVEN THO WE WERE NOT. She loved hard and was loved even HARDER. Her light belongs to everyone. SHE illuminated. Please continue to let MICHELA'S LIGHT SHINE.

Valencia was born on April 20, 1967 to Larry Daniels and Ann House in St. Louis, MO at Barnes Hospital. She attended Rancho High School and shortly thereafter started her first job at the Aladdin Hotel.

Valencia received two blessings of a lifetime when she married her former husband Michael Poole. She gave birth to two beautiful boys, Michael Poole, on February 17, 1985 and Antione Poole on May 15, 1986.

item.title: Marie Bolden
item.description:
Sunrise: July 15, 1936            Sunset: July 27, 2018
Marie Bolden, daughter of the late Reverend Nathaniel Bolden Sr. and Emma Richard Bolden, was born on July 15, 1936, in Mound, Louisiana. Marie was affectionately known to her family and friends as "Baby Sister" or "Bay Sue." Marie spent the majority of her childhood in Louisiana and later moved to Nevada as a teenager. Marie was a proud graduate of Basic High School in Henderson, Nevada. She worked determinedly to provide for her family for nearly 30 years in the hotel industry.

Marie loved to spend time caring for her family and selflessly took on the role as the family's matriarch. Marie had a strong passion for writing poems. She chronicled history, tackled topics of love and companionship, and proclaimed her faith in God through her poetry. In her free time, Marie enjoyed spending time with her grandchildren, cooking, sewing, listening to music, and collecting coins. In her youth, she loved to go to concerts and dances. As a result of her comforting spirit and welcoming personality, she was loved by many family and friends. Marie solemnly left this life on July 27, 2018.

item.title: Francisco Cooper
item.description:
Sunrise: January 27, 1952           Sunset: July 18, 2018

Francisco H. Cooper

 

 Aka Kiko, Cisco, Frank, Cooper and Coop, was a loving father, grandfather, brother, uncle companion and friend. He began his journey into this world on January 27, 1952 born in New York. In 1959, his parents moved to Groesbeck Texas where he attended and graduated from high school. Following graduation Francisco joined the Army and served his country four years. His military career brought him to San Diego California. Although he held several jobs following his military tenure, in October 1984 Francisco joined the United States Postal Service and there he remained until his retirement in 2013. After retiring from the postal service with close to thirty years of service, Francisco transitioned to Las Vegas Nevada to be closer to family.

 

 Francisco had an infectious smile. His attractive demeanor, charm and tall stature was that of royalty. Most of all, his joyous laughter left an imprint in our hearts and memories of good times shared Whether watching Star Trek, a sporting event, gambling at the casino or eating out (especially brunch), he savored every moment with family and friends.

 

 From Kiko with the biggest afro, to Cisco with the suave walk, or Frank the hardest working postal employee (never called in sick) – you were blessed to know him. In every aspect of his life, Francisco took pride in all that he did. He was the best gift wrapper (every seam even when packaging Christmas gifts) and he could put ANYTHING together (toys, bikes, home fixtures – you name it). His only flaws – yes, he had them – would be burning the meat during BBQ’s and procrastination. Francisco is known for being firm about not submitting income tax forms until the last hour – especially if he had to pay Uncle Sam.

 

 Gone to soon, Francisco departed our life on July 18, 2018. We all loved him, but God loved him more. May he rest in peace under the tender care of our Heavenly Father.

 

 Left behind to cherish his memories are his four memories, Eboni, Matthew (Rosie), Kecia (Cedric) and Rickey (Stormie), his friend Nenita & family, seven grandchildren. Two brothers William Maldonado (deceased) & Mario Maldonado (deceased). Five sisters Liduvina Jones (Dwain), Cuizelle Council Shannon (Robbie Shannon deceased), Yolanda Redic, Hermelinda Diaz Cooper, and a host of nieces, nephews and friends.

]]>

item.title: Darvious Alexander
item.description:
Sunrise: November 5, 1932    Sunset: June 29, 2018

Darvious Narvell Alexander

 

            Darvious Narvell Alexander was born August 9, 1978, in Fort Worth, Texas to the late Queen Erlinda Byrd. Darvey was raised in Las Vegas, Nevada where he attended Bertha Ronzone Elementary, Swanston Middle School, and Cimarron Memorial High School.

 

            While attending high school he found his passion for basketball and became one of Cimarron Memorial’s star players. Putting a hold on his academics, Darvey started working at Coke – Cola as a merchandiser. Darvey soon realized it was more to life so he decided to start Smilie Landscaping and travel the world. With his foot on the pedal and no brakes to pump Darvey worked smarter, grind harder, and took chances to become who he was. He went above and beyond to break bread with many and made sacrifices for his friends and family. But most of all he was a lady’s man with a finesse to charm anyone and put a smile on your face.

 

            Darvey leaves his fond memories to be cherished by his long-life companion of 23 years’s Cedrica Shelby and two very special ladies Keonna Owens and Tatyana Dupree. He also leaves to cherish 19 children; Kieere Alexander, Aliz’e Alexander, Tavasha Banks-Alexander, De’Jone Alexander, Darvon Brooks, Treyvion Harris, Elexis Alexander, De’Marco Alexander, Darnisha Brooks, De’Marz’e Alexander, Destiney Brooks, De’Shawn Alexander, De’ Metri Alexander, De’ Marion Alexander, De’ Zerrion Alexander, Darvion Alexander, Zamyia Alexander, Davion Alexander, and Darvey Alexander. Five Grandchildren with more on the way. Two fathers’, Earl Webster and Warren Byrd; Two Sisters, Lezada Alexander, and Shavanna Webster. Four brothers, Patrick Alexander (Shamika) Earl Alexander, Xavier and Ge’ Vontia Byrd. One great Aunt Velma Alexander. Three Uncles, Samuel Gholston, Rodney Gholston, Fredrick Dyanum. Three very special brothers, David Brown, Arnez Moore and James Crockett whom proceeds him in death. Darvey is proceeded in death by. His Mother Erlinda Byrd (Alexander), Grandmother Lezada Gholston, Auntie Minnie Gholston and two children Devont’e and A’Ziyah Alexander. Darvey also leaves a host of cousins, nieces, nephews, great nieces, great nephews, friends and a lot of HATERS.

]]>
